Headings are for convenience only and do not affect the interpretation of these
Articles

Words importing the singular include the plural and vice versa.

Words importing the masculine gender shall include the feminine gender and
vice versa.

The provisions of the Companies Act, 1956 and any statutory modifications
thereof at any time shall apply to the Company. Where in the construction or
interpretation of any of these Articles it is found that the same are inconsistent
or repugnant with the provisions of the Act the provisions of the Act, with
statutory modifications there of shall apply.

a reference to a document includes an amendment or supplement to, or
replacement or novation of, that document but disregarding any amendment,
supplement, replacement or novation made in breach of this Agreement;

a reference to any statute or law will include all rules, regulations, directions,
guidelines and notifications enacted thereunder and any modification, re-
enactment, substitution or amendment relating thereto as may be made from
time to time;

a reference to a party to any document, who is an individual, includes that
party's heirs, executors, administrators, legal representatives, successors and
permitted assigns and for all other parties to any document, includes that party's
successors and permitted assigns; and

“Including” and “include” shall be deemed to mean “including, without
limitation” and “include, without limitation.”

3. Table “A not to apply

No regulation contained in table A in the First Schedule to the Companies Act, 1956 shall apply
to this Company.

4. Commencement of new business
Subject to the provisions of the sub-section (ZA) of Section 149 of the Act and these Articles,
the Company may from time to time commence any new business in relation to any of the
objects set out in clause III (C) of the Memorandum of Association.

IL. CAPITAL

5.

The Authorized share capital of the Company is Rs. 16,00,00,000/- (Rupees Sixteen Crores
Only) divided into 12,00,00,000 (Rupees Twelve Crores Only) Equity Capital comprising
of 1,20,00,000 (One Crore Twenty Lakhs) Common Shares of Rs.10 each and Rs. 4 Crores
(Rupees Four Crores Only) Preferred Capital comprising of 40,00,000 (Forty Lakhs Only)
Preferred Shares of Rs.10/- each with rights, privileges and conditions attached thereto as
are provided by the Articles of the Company for the time being with the power subject to
these Articles, to increase or reduce the capital of the Company and to divide the shares in
the capital for the time being into several classes and attach thereto respectively subject to
the laws for the time being in force and these Articles, such rights, privileges and conditions
as may be determined by or in accordance with the regulations of the Company and to vary,
modify, abrogate any such rights, privileges or conditions in such manner as may for the
time being be provided by these Articles..

The preference shares, if any, shall confer on the holders thereof the right to receive a fixed
cumulative preference divided at such rate per annum as shall be decided by the Company
at the time of issue and the right in a winding up to payment of capital and arrears of
dividend whether declared or not up to commencement of winding up in priority to the
equity shares but shall not confer any further right to participate in profits or assets, subject
to the provisions contained in these Articles.

BCI shall have waived any right it may have to request the issuance of any new Shares from
the Company.

Subject to the provisions of these Articles, the Company in a General Meeting may, from
time to time by a Special Resolution increase the Capital by the creation of new shares, such
increase to be of such aggregate amount and to be divided into shares of such respective
amounts as the resolution shall prescribe. Subject to the provisions of the Act and these
Articles, any Shares of the original or increased Capital shall be issued upon such terms and
conditions and with such rights and privileges annexed thereto, as the General Meeting
resolving upon the creation thereof, shall direct, and if no direction be given, as the
Directors shall determine; and in particular, such shares may be issued with a preferential or
qualified right to dividend, and in the distribution of assets of the Company, and with a right
of voting at General Meetings of the Company in conformity with Sections 87 and 88 of the
Act. Whenever the Capital of the Company has been increased under the provisions of this
Article, the Directors shall comply with the provisions of Section 97 of the Act.

Subject to these Articles and the relevant provisions of the Act as may be applicable, the
Company may from time to time by Special Resolution, reduce its Capital or Share Capital
(if any) or its capital redemption reserve account or securities premium account in any
manner for the time being authorised by law, and in particular, Share Capital may be paid
off on the footing that it may be called upon again or otherwise.

10
2.

HI.

Subject to the provisions of these Articles and Section 94 of the Act, the Company pursuant
to a resolution passed by its Members at a General Meeting, may from time to time sub-
divide or consolidate its shares, or any of them, and the resolution whereby any shares are
sub-divided or consolidated may determine, that, as between the holders of the shares
resulting from such subdivision or consolidation, one or more of such shares shall have
some preference or special advantages as regards dividends, capital or otherwise over or as
compared with the other or others. Subject as aforesaid, the Company, pursuant to a
resolution passed by its Members at a General Meeting, may also cancel shares which have
not been taken or agreed to be taken by any Person and diminish the amount of its Capital
by the amount of the shares so cancelled.

Whenever the Capital, by reason of the issue of preference shares (including the Preference
Shares) or otherwise, is divided into different classes of shares, all or any of the right and
privileges attached to each class may, subject to the provisions of these Articles and Section
106 and 107 of the Act, only be modified, commuted, affected or abrogated by agreement
between the Company and each of the beneficial owner of such preference shares.

SHARES AND CERTIFICATES

. Subject to the provisions of the Act and these Articles the shares shall be under the control

of the Directors, who may allot or otherwise dispose off the same to such persons on such
terms and conditions, and at such times as the Directors may think fit. Provided that option
or right to call on share shall not be given to any person or persons without the sanction of
the Company in General Meeting and where at any time it is proposed to increase the
subscribed capital of the Company by the issue of new shares, then subject to the provisions
of Section 81 of the Act and these Articles, the Board shall issue such shares in the manner
provided therein.

. The joint holders of a share shall be severally as well as jointly liable for the payment of all

installments and calls and interest on installments and calls due in respect of such shares.

. Subject to these Articles, shares may be registered in the name of any person, the joint

holders or any limited Company, but not in the name of a minor, and not more than two
persons shall be registered as joint holders of any share.

. Subject to the provisions of the Act and these Articles, or as the Directors may allot and

issue shares in the capital of the Company in payment of part payment for any property sold
or transferred, goods or machinery supplied or for services rendered to the company in or
about the conduct of its business and any shares, which may be so allotted may be issued as
fully paid up share or partly paid up shares otherwise than in cash.

. Every person whose name is entered as a member in the register of members or allottee

shall be entitled to receive without payment, one share certificate specifying the name of the
person/allottee in whose favour it is issued, the share to which it relates and the amount paid
up thereon, unless such person opts to subscribe to such shares in the dematerialized form. .

. Every share certificate shall be issued under the Seal of the Company and shall be signed by

(i) two Directors (ii) a Secretary or any other person authorized for the purpose by the

1
20.

21.

22.

Board of Directors. Every certificate shall specify the shares to which 1t relates and the
amount paid up thereon and be issued in accordance with the Companies (Issue of Share
Certificate) Rules, 1960.

. In respect of any share held jointly by two persons, the company shall not be bound to issue

more than one certificate and delivery of the certificate to the first named person of the two
joint holders shall be sufficient delivery to both the holders.

. If any certificate be wom out, decrepit or defaced or torn, or if there are no further cages on

the reverse thereof for the endorsements of transfer, then upon production thereof of such
certificate to the Directors they may order the same to be cancelled and may issue a new
certificate in lieu thereof which shall state on the face of it that it is issued in lieu of such
certificate provided the certificate in lieu of which it is issued is surrendered to the
Company and the new certificate records that it is issued in lieu of such certificates or on
such consolidation, and if any certificate be lost or destroyed, then, upon proof thereof to
the satisfaction of the Directors and on such indemnity as the Directors deem adequate
being given, a new certificate in lieu thereof may be given to the party entitled to such lost
or destroyed Certificate. Similarly, if any share or shares be surrendered to the Company for
sub-division and split or consolidation, the Board may order the same to be done free of
charge.

. The out of pocket expenses incurred by the Company in investigation for evidence and the

advertisement cost or such less sum as the directors may determine shall be paid to the
company for every new certificate.

Provided that no fees shall be charged for sub-division or consolidation of certificates into
lots of the market unit or for issue of new certificate in replacement of those which are old,
decrepit or worn out or where cages on the reverse for the endorsements for transfer have
been fully utilized.

None of the funds of the Company shall be employed in the purchase of or lent on shares of
the Company and the Company shall not except as permitted by Section 77 of the Act and
subject to the consent of the investors and the provisions of these Articles, give any
financial assistance for the purpose of or in connection with any purchase of shares in the
company.

The shares in the Capital shall be numbered progressively according to their several
denominations and, except in the manner herein before mentioned, no share shall be
subdivided; provided, however, that the provision relating to progressive numbering shall
not apply to the shares of the company which have been dematerialized. Every forfeited or
surrendered share shall continue to bear the number by which the same was originally
distinguished.

Any application signed by or on behalf of an applicant for shares in the Company, followed
by an allotment of any share therein, shall be an acceptance of shares within the meaning of
these Articles, and every Person who thus or otherwise accepts any shares and whose name
is on the Register of Members shall, for the purpose of these Articles, be a Member.

12
25.

24.

25.

26.

The money (1f any) which the Board shall, on the allotment of any shares being made by
them, require or direct to be paid by way of deposit, call or otherwise, in respect of any
shares allotted by them, shall immediately on the insertion of the name of the allottee in the
Register of Members as the holder of such shares, becomes a debt due to and recoverable by
the Company from the allottee thereof, and shall be paid by him accordingly.

Every Member, and, in the event of his death, the heirs, executors or administrator of such
deceased Members shall pay to the Company the portion of the Share Capital represented
by his share or shares which may, for the time being, remain unpaid thereon, in such
amounts, at such time or times, and in such manner as the Board shall, from time to time, in
accordance with the Company's Articles, require or fix for the payment thereof.

Subject to the provisions of these Articles:-

(a) All blank forms to be used for issue of shares certificates shall be printed and the
printing shall be done only on the authority of a resolution of the Board. The blank
forms shall be consecutively machine-numbered and the forms and the blocks,
engravings, facsimiles and hues relating to the printing of such forms shall be kept in
the custody of the Secretary or such other Person as the Board may appoint for the
purpose; and the Secretary or the other Person aforesaid shall be responsible for
rendering an account of these forms to the Board.

(b) The Managing Director of the Company for the time being or, if the Company has no
Managing Director, every Director of the Company shall be responsible for the
maintenance, preservation and safe custody of all books and documents relating to the
issue of share certificates except the blank forms or share certificates referred to in
Clause (c).

(c) All books referred to in clause (b) shall be preserved in good order permanently.

(a) Where two or more Persons are registered as the holders of any share, they shall be
deemed to hold the same as joint tenants with benefits of survivorship subject to the
following and other provision contained in these Articles.

(b) On the death of any such joint-holder, the survivors or survivor shall be the only
Persons or Person recognised by the Company as having any title to the share, but the
Directors may require such evidence of death as they may deem fit and nothing herein
contained shall be taken to release the estate of the deceased joint-holder from any
liability on the shares held by him jointly with any other Person.

(c) Any of such joint holders may give effectual receipts for any dividends or other
moneys payable in respect of such share.

(d) Only the Person whose name stands in the Register of Members as the first of the joint
holders of any share shall be entitled to delivery of the certificate relating to such share
or to receive notices from the Company and any notice given to such Person shall be
deemed proper notice to all joint-holders.

13
(e) Any one of two or more joint holders may vote at any meeting either personally or by
proxy in respect of such share as if he were solely entitled thereto, and if more than one
of such joint-holders be present at any meeting personally or by proxy, the holder
whose name stands first or higher (as the case may be) on the Register or Members in
respect of such share shall alone be entitled to vote in respect thereof.

PROVIDED always that a Person present at any meeting personally shall be entitled to
vote in preference to a Person present by proxy although the name of such Person
present by proxy stands first on the Register of Members in respect of such shares.

27. Save as herein otherwise provided, the Company shall be entitled to treat the Person whose
name appears on the Register of Members as the holder of any share or whose name
appears as the Beneficial Owner of shares in the records of the Depository, as the absolute
owner thereof and accordingly shall not (except as ordered by a Court of competent
jurisdiction or as by law required) be bound to recognise any benami trust or equity or
equitable contingent or other claim to or interest in such share on the part of any other
Person whether or not it shall have express or implied notice thereof.

28. The Company shall be entitled to dematerialise its shares, debentures and other securities
pursuant to the Depositories Act and to offer its shares, debentures and other securities for
subscription both in material and dematerialised form in any media as permitted by law
including any form of electronic media.

IV. DEMATERIALISATION OF SECURITIES
29. For the purpose of these Articles: -

“Beneficial Owner” means a Person or Persons whose name is recorded as such with a
depository.

“Depository' means a company formed and registered under the Act, and which has
been granted a certificate of registration to act as a depository under the Securities &
Exchange Board of India Act, 1992.

“Depositories Act” shall mean the Depositories Act 1996 and any statutory modification
of re-enactment thereof.

30. The Company shall be entitled to dematerialize its securities and to offer securities in a
dematerialized form pursuant to the Depositories Act and to rematerialize the securities held
in Depositories.

31. Every Person subscribing to securities offered by the Company shall have the option to
receive security certificates or to hold the securities with a Depository. Such a Person who
is the Beneficial Owner of the securities can at any time opt out of a Depository, if
permitted by Applicable Law, in respect of any security in the manner provided by the
Depositories Act, and the Company shall in the manner and within the time prescribed,
issue to the Beneficial Owner the required certificates of securities.

14
32.

33.

34.

35.

36.

37.

38.

lf a Person opts to hold his security with a Depository, the Company shall intimate such
Depository of the details of allotment of the security, and on receipt of the information, the
Depository, shall enter in its record the name of the allottee as the Beneficial Owner of the
security.

All securities held by a Depository shall be dematerialized and be in fungible form.

(a) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the Act, the Depositaries Act but
subject to these Articles, a Depository shall be deemed to be the registered owner for the
purposes of effecting transfer of any ownership of security on behalf of the Beneficial
Owner.

(b) Save as otherwise provided in (a) above, the Depository as the registered owner of the
securities shall not have any voting rights or any other rights in respect of the securities held
byit.

(c) Every Person, holding securities of the Company and whose name is entered as the
Beneficial Owner in records of the Depository shall be deemed to be a Member of the
Company. The Beneficial Owner of securities shall be entitled to all the rights, benefits, and
be subject to all the liabilities in respect of his securities, which are held by a Depository.

Notwithstanding anything in the Act or these Articles to the contrary, where securities are
held in a Depository, the records of the beneficial ownership may be served by such
Depository on the Company by means of electronic mode or by delivery of floppies or
discs.

Subject to the provisions of these Articles, nothing contained in Section 108 of the Act shall
apply to a transfer of securities effected by a transferor and the transferee both of whom are
entered as Beneficial Owners in the records of a Depository.

Notwithstanding anything in the Act or these Articles, where securities are dealt with by a
Depository, the Company shall intimate the details thereof to the Depository immediately
on allotment of such securities.

Nothing contained in the Act or these Articles regarding the necessity of having distinctive
numbers for securities issued by the Company shall apply to securities held with a
Depository.

The register and index of Beneficial Owners of the securities issued by the Company
maintained by a Depository under the Depositories Act, shall be deemed to be the Register
of Members and Index of Members and security holders for the purposes of these Articles.

V. BROKERAGE AND COMMISSION

39.

Subject to these Articles and the consent of the Investors, the Company may on any issue of
shares or debentures pay such brokerage as may be reasonable and lawful.

15
40.

41.

VI.

42.

Subejct to the provisions of the Act and these Articles, the Company at any time, may pay a
commission to any person for subscribing or agreeing to subscribe (whether absolutely or
conditionally) for any shares, debentures or debenture stock in the Company, or procuring
or agreeing to procure subscriptions (whether absolutely or conditionally) for any shares,
debentures or debenture stock in the Company, but so that the commission shall not exceed
five percent of the price at which the shares are issued or two and a half percent of the price
at which debentures are issued.

The commission may be satisfied by payment of cash or by allotment of fully or partly paid
shares or partly in one way and partly in the other.

TERMS OF ISSUE OF PREFERENCE SHARES

Subject to the provisions of Section 80 of the Act and these Articles, the Company shall
have power to issue preference shares carrying a right to redemption out of the profits or out
of the proceeds of a fresh issue of shares made for the purposes of such redemption or liable
to be so redeemed at the option of the Company.

The terms of the Preferred Shares shall be as follows. The Promoters shall exercise their
voting rights to give full force and effect to this Article.

(a) Dividends. The Preferred Shares shall be entitled to a one percent (1%) annual
cumulative compounding dividend payable on any issued and outstanding Preferred
Shares and on any accrued but unpaid dividends. The Company shall declare and pay
dividends at such rates on the Preferred Shares subscribed by the Investors so as to
ensure that the entitlement referred to above is paid before any payment of dividends on
the Common Shares. In addition, the holders of the Preferred Shares shall be entitled to
participate in any dividend paid on the Common Shares on an as-converted basis.

(b) Rights of Preferred Shares. The Preferred Shares shall be senior to all other classes of
Shares in relation to dividends, liquidation, redemption and other distributions.

(c) Conversion. The conversion rights for the Preferred Shares shall be as set forth below:

(1) Either Investor, upon delivery of notice to the Company and the other Investor,
shall have the option, at its sole election, to convert its Preferred Shares into
Common Shares on a 1:1 basis at a conversion price that is equal to the Rupee
price at which a Preferred Share was subscribed to by such Investor, provided
that such basis and price shall be adjusted in accordance with Anti Dilution and
Preemptive rights laid out in Article 45.

(ii) Simultaneously with the occurrence of a Qualified IPO, the Preferred Shares
will automatically convert into Common Shares on a 1:1 basis at a conversion
price that is equal to the Rupee price at which a Preferred Share was subscribed
to by the Investors; provided that such basis and price shall be adjusted in
accordance with Anti Dilution and Preemptive Rights laid out in Article 45.

16
(ui) | In the event that Applicable Law prevents or limits the application of the
conversion formula set forth in subsection (1) or (ii) above, then: (1) the number
of Common Shares to be issued to either Investor in exchange for its Preferred
Shares shall be the maximum amount permitted by Applicable Law (including,
as applicable, in the event that that Applicable Law prevents the full adjustment
of the Conversion Price in accordance with the Anti Dilution and Preemptive
Rights mentioned in Article 45, the adjustment of such Conversion Price to the
lowest price permitted under Applicable Law) and (2) the Company shall issue
and offer to such Investor at the lowest price permitted by Applicable Law,
such number of additional Common Shares so as to make up any shortfall in the
conversion to Common Shares based on the intended application of the formula
set forth above.

(d) Liguidation Preference. Upon the occurrence of a Liquidity Event, either Investor shall,

at its sole option, be entitled to redeem its Preferred Shares for an amount equal to the
Rupee price at which such Investor's Preferred Shares were subscribed by it, plus a
liquidation premium equal to an amount that would give such Investor an IRR of: (i)
twenty percent (20%) in case of any Liquidity Event occurring on or before March 31,
2007, (ii) ten percent (10%) in case of any Liquidity Event occurring after March 31,
2007 but on or before March 31, 2009 and (iii) no additional amount in case of any
Liquidity Event occurring after March 31, 2009 (in case of sections (i) and (ii) above,
inclusive of any dividends or other distributions that have been made with respect to the
Preferred Shares being redeemed pursuant to the conditions set out in this Article;
provided, however, in the event that the redemption price calculated in accordance with
the formula set forth above would be in excess of the maximum amount permitted by
Applicable Law, then (i) the Company shall make all reasonable efforts to obtain any
Authorizations necessary to allow the contracted redemption price, and in the event that
each Investor agrees that such Authorizations will not be obtainable, the redemption
price shall be set at such maximum permitted price.

Strategic Liguidation Preference. Upon the occurrence of a Strategic Liquidity Event,
either Investor shall, at its sole option, be entitled to redeem its Preferred Shares for an
amount equal to the greater of (subject to Applicable Law): (i) its pro rata share of the
value realized by the Company from such Strategic Liquidity Event determined on an
as-converted basis (i.e., calculated based on a conversion of Preferred Shares into
Common Shares in accordance with the conditions laid out under the Article dealing
with Conversion (mentioned in clause (c) above) and (ii) the Rupee price at which such
Investor's Preferred Shares were subscribed by it, plus a redemption premium equal to
an amount that would give such Investor an IRR of twenty-five percent (25%)
(inclusive of any dividends or other distributions that have been made with respect to
the Preferred Shares being redeemed pursuant to this clause; provided, however, in the
event that the redemption price calculated in accordance with the formula set forth
above would be in excess of the maximum amount permitted by Applicable Law, then
(i) the Company shall make all reasonable efforts to obtain any Authorizations
necessary to allow the contracted redemption price, and in the event that each Investor

17
agrees that such Authorizations will not be obtainable, the redemption price shall be set
at such maximum permitted price.

(f) Redemption. At the sole option of either Investor, the Company will be required to
redeem all or part of such Investor's Preferred Shares in the event that: (i) no Qualified
IPO shall have occurred by September 30, 2009, (ii) the Promoters at any time hold less
than forty-five percent (45%) of the voting and economic interest in the Company, on
either an outstanding, or a fully-diluted basis, or (iii) the Shareholders (including the
Promoters) hold less than seventy-six percent (76%) of the voting and economic interest
in the Company, on either an outstanding, or a fully-diluted basis; provided, however,
the Company shall not be required to redeem the Investor's Preferred Shares in
accordance with sub-clause (iii) above in the event that a Transfer by one or both of the
Investors is the sole cause of the Shareholders holding less than seventy-six percent
(76%) of the voting and economic interest in the Company, on either an outstanding, or
a fully-diluted basis. The date of any such notice by either Investor to the Company
shall be the "Redemption Election Date." Upon such redemption by either Investor, it
shall receive an amount equal to the greater of (as permitted by Applicable Law):

(1) the fair market value of its Preferred Shares to be determined by an independent
firm or investment bankers mutually agreeable to the Investors and the
Company; provided, any fees and costs payable in connection with such
valuation shall be borne by the Company;

(1) the Rupee price at which such Investor's Preferred Shares were subscribed by it,
plus a redemption premium equal to an IRR of fifteen percent (15%) (inclusive
of any dividends or other distributions that have been made with respect to the
Preferred Shares being redeemed) (the amount determined in accordance with
(1) or (ii) above, the "Redemption Price"),

provided, however, in the event that the Redemption Price calculated in
accordance with each of (i) and (ii) above would be in excess of the maximum
amount permitted by Indian law, then (i) the Company shall make all
reasonable efforts to obtain any Authorizations necessary to allow the
contracted redemption price, and in the event that such electing Investor agrees
that such Authorizations will not be obtainable, the Redemption Price shall be
set at such maximum permitted price.

The Redemption Price will be payable in one (1) installment within forty-five
(45) Business Days from the date of the written request for redemption.

(g) Additional Rights of Preferred Shares. Prior to a Qualified IPO, the Investors shall be
permitted to hold the Preferred Shares and not convert the same to Common Shares for
as long as permitted by Applicable Law.

(h) Promoter Buy-Back. In the event that a Qualified IPO has not occurred by September
30, 2009, either Investor may, at its sole option call on the Promoters, and the
Promoters shall use their best efforts, to purchase all (but not less than all) of such
Investor's Shares for an amount in Rupees equal to the greater of:

18
(1) the fair market value of its Shares to be determined by an independent firm of
investment bankers mutually agreeable to the Investors and the Company;
provided, any fees and costs payable in connection with such valuation shall be
bome by the Company;

(1) the Rupee price at which such Investor's Shares were subscribed by it, plus a
sale premium equal to an amount that would give the Investor an IRR of fifteen
percent (15%) (inclusive of any dividends or other distributions that have been
made with respect to the Preferred Shares being redeemed).

Furthermore, the Promoters shall: (A) send a confirmation to the Investors of the
Promoters agreement hereunder to purchase the Investor's Shares in accordance with
this clause, within twenty-one (21) days of receipt of notice from either Investor of its
election to sell their Shares, and (B) make all reasonable efforts to obtain any
Authorizations that may be required to complete the purchase of such Investor's Shares
in accordance with the terms above). Subject to receipt of any required Authorizations,
the Promoters shall complete such purchase within sixty (60) days of its receipt of
notice from either Investor of its election to sell its Shares pursuant to the conditions
laid out above.

(i) Drag-Along Rights. In the event that the Promoters (i) fail to issue a confirmation of
their agreement to purchase the Investor's Shares in accordance with the above dealing
with Promoter's Buy-back, within fifteen (15) days or (ii) upon issuing such notice, fail
to conclude their purchase of the Investor's Preferred Shares within sixty (60) days
(including the receipt of any Authorization that may be required to complete the
purchase of the Investor's Shares in accordance with the terms of Promoter's Buy-back
(mentioned above), the Investors, acting jointly, may require the Company to appoint a
reputed investment banker, who shall be acceptable to the Investors, to offer for sale
any or all Shares held by the Investors and the Promoters in the Company to a third
party, and upon approval of the terms and conditions of any such sale by the Investors,
such investment banker shall have the right to call upon the Investors and the Promoters
to sell all or a part of their respective shareholdings in the Company to such third party
on the terms and conditions approved by the Investors; provided, however, the
Promoters shall have a limited right of first refusal to purchase the Investors” Shares at
such agreed upon terms and conditions as notified by the investment banker and
approved by the Investors, which right must be exercised by payment of funds to the
Investors (or as they may otherwise direct) within two (2) Business Days from receipt
of the call from the investment banker.

VII. FURTHER ISSUE AND RESTRICTIONS ON TRANSFER

43. Restrictions on Transfer. The Promoters shall not, directly or indirectly, Transfer all or any
of the Shares held by them except in accordance with these Articles. Any Transfer in
breach of these Articles shall be null and void, and shall not be binding on the Company.

44. Promoter Lock-ln. Until the Common Shares of the Company have been listed pursuant to

a Qualified IPO, no Promoter shall, directly or indirectly, transfer any Shares or Share
Equivalents held by it in the Company (except in accordance with the terms of these

19
Articles); provided, however, the Promoters may collectively transfer an aggregate of up to
five percent (5%) of their Shareholding in the Company to third parties prior to the listing
of the Common Shares of the Company pursuant to a Qualified IPO. The Promoters shall
ensure that prior to any such transfers being effective, the prospective transferee shall sign a
deed of adherence agreeing to be bound by the terms of these Articles, in the form and
substance satisfactory to the Investors. The provisions of this clause shall commence as of
the Effective Date.

45. Anti Dilution and Preemptive Rights. In the event the Company issues any new Shares or
Share Equivalents at any point of time prior to a Qualified IPO (a "Fresh Offering") (other
than stock options/Shares granted/issued under the ESOP) in accordance with Investor
Consent Rights, the following procedure shall apply:

o)

Gi)

(iii)

if such Fresh Offering is only to the Shareholders of the Company, each
Investor shall have a right, exercisable at its sole discretion, to subscribe to such
number of Shares or Share Equivalents out of the Fresh Offering so as to ensure
that such Investor's post-Fresh Offering Shareholding is the same as such
Investor's Shareholding prior to the Fresh Offering. For this purpose, the
parties hereto shall cause the Company to, separately, pass a special resolution
issuing and allotting Shares or Share Equivalents to each of the Investors to
ensure compliance with these Articles If either Investor elects to subscribe,
such Investor shall subscribe to the Fresh Offering at such price as the Board
shall have determined for the Fresh Offering.

if such Fresh Offering is to Persons other than the Shareholders, the parties
hereto shall cause the Company to allocate such Fresh Offering or part thereof
to the Investors, on the same terms and conditions (including price) as are being
offered to the third party, such that each Investor's Shareholding in the
Company prior to such Fresh Offering is maintained.

Notwithstanding anything contained in (i) and (ii) above, if the Shares or Share
Equivalents included in the Fresh Offering are to be sold at a price that is lower
than the price at which Preferred Shares were subscribed to by the Investors
under the Subscription Agreement, the price at which the Preferred Shares
would have been convertible into Common Shares (the "Conversion Price")
shall be revised downward such that it is equal to the weighted average of the
purchase price(s) of the Shares or Share Equivalents included in the Fresh
Offering (the "Adjusted Conversion Price") and each Investor shall be entitled
to such number of Common Shares on conversion as are arrived at by
multiplying the Conversion Price of the Preferred Shares in effect immediately
prior to such Fresh Offering by the number of Common Shares issuable
pursuant to a conversion immediately prior to such Fresh Offering and dividing
the product thereof by the Adjusted Conversion Price. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, in the event that the price of Shares or Share Equivalents proposed
for the Fresh Offering would result in an Adjusted Conversion Price that is
below the fair value at which the Preferred Shares could be converted into
Common Shares (as determined in accordance with Applicable Law), the prior
written approval of the Investors shall be required for such Fresh Offering. The

20
Company shall ensure that all required Authorizations (including any
Authorizations required to adjust the Conversions Price in accordance with the
terms hereof) for the aforesaid shall be obtained by it and in the absence of such
approvals, shall not undertake such Fresh Offering. The Conversion Price will
also be adjusted to fully reflect on a proportionate basis share splits, share
dividends, recapitalizations and any other changes to the capital structure of the
Company, which actions shall only be undertaken if the Company had obtained
all required Authorizations (including any Authorizations required to adjust the
Conversion Price in accordance with the terms hereof).

 

Upon the occurrence of each adjustment or readjustment of the Conversion
Price pursuant to this Article, the Company at its expense shall promptly
compute such adjustment or readjustment in accordance with the terms hereof
and prepare and furnish to the Investors a certificate executed by an officer of
the Company setting forth such adjustment or readjustment and showing in
detail the facts upon which such adjustment or readjustment is based, including
as applicable, any Authorizations obtained in connection with such adjustment
or readjustment. The Company shall, upon the written request at any time of
either Investor, furnish or cause to be furnished to the Investors a like certificate
setting forth (i) such adjustments and readjustments and (ii) the Adjusted
Conversion Price. The delivery or acceptance of any such certificate by an
Investor shall in not be deemed to be an acceptance by such Investor of any
statements or calculations set forth therein.

(iv) In the event that either Investor is unable to subscribe to any Shares or Share
Equivalents under this Article because of a restriction under Applicable Law,
such Investor shall have the right to nominate a third party, who is not a
Competitor, to subscribe to the Shares and/or Share Equivalents being offered
toit.

46. Tag Along Rights. (a) Subject to the provisions of these Articles, and at any time prior to a
Qualified IPO, in the event that any Promoter, either directly or indirectly, proposes to
Transfer the Shares or Share Equivalents held by it or a part thereof to a third party in a
single or a series of transactions and after such Transfer (whether as a result of such
Transfer or otherwise) the Promoters would collectively hold less than forty-five percent
(45%) of the Share Capital, any such Transfer shall be conditioned upon such third party
agreeing to acquire all the Shares each of the Investors elects to sell on the same terms and
conditions as would be received by the relevant Promoter(s) and otherwise in the manner
specified in (b) below;

(b) Subject to (a) above, upon identifying a third party to acquire Shares held by
them or any part thereof, the Promoters shall communicate the same to the Investors setting
out the following details in relation to the third party's offer (the "Sale Notice"): (i) price per
Share; (ii) number of Shares proposed to be Transferred; (iii) identity and material
particulars regarding the third party; and (iv) material terms and conditions for the proposed
Transfer. Each Investor shall, within a period of sixty (60) days from the date of receipt of
the Sale Notice, be entitled to exercise its tag along rights and offer all of its Shares, or such
lesser amount of Shares as either Investor may elect, to the third party. Any such Transfer

 

24
47.

of the Promoter Shares to the third party shall be conditional upon such third party
acquiring the Shares offered by either Investor in exercise of its tag along rights on terms no
less favourable than those offered by such third party to the Promoters (including the receipt
of any Authorizations as may be required to achieve such terms).

Right of First Refusal. Subject to the limitations on Transfers set forth in Article 43 and 44,
if any of the Promoters or Investors, either individually or collectively, (the "Transferor(s)")
desire to Transfer all or any portion of the Shares held by it or them (the "Transfer Shares")
to any third party (the "Transferee"), prior to the Qualified IPO, the following procedures
shall be complied with:

a.

The Transferor shall notify each of the Investors and other Promoters (the
"Offerees"), in writing (a "Notice of Transfer"), specifying (i) the number of
Transfer Shares subject to Transfer, (ii) the name and business address of the
prospective Transferee (iii) the price per Share of the Transfer Shares (which
shall be payable all in cash at closing) (the "Transfer Price"); and (iv) other
terms of the proposed Transfer (collectively, the "Conditions of Transfer") and
furnish a copy of the offer made by the Transferee. In the event that the
proposed consideration for the Transfer includes consideration other than cash,
such consideration shall consist of liquid listed securities based on the weighted
average trading price of such liquid listed securities on an exchange on which
the shares are most traded for a period of ten (10) Business Days prior to the
date on which the Notice of Transfer is received by the Investors. The total
value of the consideration for the proposed Transfer is referred to herein as the
"Transfer Price" (as defined above).

Thereupon, each Offeree shall have the right to purchase, or to designate a third
party, who is not a Competitor, to purchase, all, but not less than all, of the
Transfer Shares equal to a percentage equal to such Offeree's percentage
ownership of the Share Capital of the Company on an as-converted basis.
Within thirty (30) days from receipt of the Notice of Transfer (the "Subscription
Period"), each Offeree shall notify the Transferor of its intention to exercise or
not to exercise its right of first refusal to purchase its pro rata portion of the
Transfer Shares in accordance with the Conditions of Transfer at the Transfer
Price ("Acceptance Notice").

Each Acceptance Notice shall include a statement that such Offeree or its
designated nominee is willing to acquire its pro rata share of the Transfer
Shares. An Acceptance Notice shall be irrevocable and shall constitute a
binding agreement, which binds the Transferor to sell the Offered Shares to the
accepting Offeree(s) or its/their designated nominee(s).

If any Offeree exercises such right of first refusal to purchase the Transfer
Shares by notifying the Transferor thereof within the Subscription Period, the
purchase of the Transfer Shares by any such Offeree shall be closed within
thirty (30) days after receipt of such notice of exercise by the Transferor at the
registered office of the Company.

22
e. Im the event that any Offeree elects not exercise its right of first refusal to
purchase the Transfer Shares within the Subscription Period, the Transferor
may sell, assign or transfer all, but not less than all, of the Transfer Shares to
the Transferee and any Offeree(s) that have elected to exercise its/their right of
first refusal within a period of one hundred eighty (180) days after the
expiration of the Subscription Period; provided, however, that (i) the Transferee
shall not be a Competitor of the Company, (ii) the Transferee shall agree in
advance in writing to comply with all of the applicable obligations of the
Transferor under these Articles and shall execute a deed of accession, (iii) the
transfer to the Transferee shall be on terms and conditions no more favorable to
the Transferee than the Conditions of Transfer specified in the Notice of
Transfer, including the Transfer Price and (iv) the Transfer is subject to
Section 4.04 hereof. In the event that the Transferor is not able to consummate
the Transfer of the Transfer Shares within such one hundred eighty-day period,
any subsequent Transfer of the Transfer Shares shall again be subject to the
provisions of this Article.

f. Notwithstanding the foregoing, from and after the earlier to occur of a Strategic
Liguidity Event and September 30, 2009, the right of first refusal set forth in
this Article shall not apply to any Transfer of Shares by the Investors.

g. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the provisions of
this Article shall not apply: to any tender of Shares in connection with the
Qualified IPO.

VIII. INTEREST OUT OF CAPITAL

48.

Where any shares are issued for the purpose of raising money to defray the expenses of the
construction of any works or buildings, or the provisions of any plant, which cannot be
made profitable for a long period, the Company may pay interest on so much of the Share
Capital, for the period, at the rate and subject to the conditions and restrictions provided by
Section 208 of the Act and may charge the same to the capital as part of the cost of
construction of the work or building, or the provision of the plant.

IX. CALL ON SHARES

49.

50.

The Board of Directors may by a resolution passed at a meeting of the Board from time to
time, subject to any terms on which any shares have been issued, make such calls as they
think fit upon the share holders in respect of all moneys unpaid on the shares held by them
respectively and each member shall pay the amount of every call so made on him to the
persons at such time and place appointed by the Board. A call may be made payable by
installments.

A call shall be deemed to have been made at the time when the resolution of the Board of
Directors authorizing such call was passed.

23
51. Not less than fourteen clear day's notice of any call shall be given by the company (either
by letter to the members or b y advertisement) specifying the time and place of payment and
to whom such payment shall be paid.

52. If by the terms of issue of any share of otherwise any amount is made payable on allotment
or at any fixed time or by installments at fixed times whether on account of nominal amount
of the share or by way or premium, every such amount or installment shall be payable as if
it were a call duty made by the Directors and of which due notice had been given and all the
provisions herein contained in respect of the calls shall relate to such amount of installment
accordingly.

In the case of non-payment of such sum all the relevant provisions of these Articles to
payment of interest and expenses, forfeiture or otherwise shall apply as if such sum had
become payable by virtue of a call duly made and notified.

53. If the sum payable in respect of any call or installment be not paid on or before the day
appointed for the payment thereof, the holder for the time being of the share in respect of
which the call shall have been made or the installment shall be due, shall pay interest for the
same at the rate of 18 percent per annum or at such rate as the Directors may determine
from time to time, from the day appointed for the payment thereof to the time of actual
payment. The Directors shall be at liberty to waive payment of any such interest wholly or
in part.

54. The Board may, subject to Section 92 of the Act, receive from any member willing to
advance all or any part of money unpaid upon the shares held by him beyond the sums
actually called for and upon the money so paid in advance exceeds the amount of calls thus
made upon the shares in respect of which such advance has been made, the Company may
pay interest at such rate as the member paying such sum in advance and the Board agrees
upon. Money so paid in excess of amount of calls shall not rank for dividend or participate
in profits or confer on such member any other rights until it is appropriated towards
satisfaction of any call. The directors may at any time repay the amount so advanced.

55. A call may be revoked or postponed at the discretion of the Board.

56. On the trail or hearing of any action for the recovery of any money due for any call it shall
be sufficient to prove that the name of the member sued is entered in the register as the
holder, or one of the holders of the shares in respect of which such debt accrued; that the
resolution making the call is duly recorded in the minutes book; and that notice of such call
was duly given to the member, in pursuance of these Articles, and it shall not be necessary
to prove the appointment of the Directors who made such call, nor any other matter
whatsoever, but the proof of the matters aforesaid shall be conclusive evidence of the debt.

X. FORFEITURE, SURRENDER AND LIEN

57. If any Member fails to pay any call, or installment on or before the day appointed for
payment thereof, the Board may at any time there after, during such time as the call or
installment remain unpaid, serve notice on him to pay the same together with any interest
that may have accrued, any expenses that may have been incurred by the Company by

24
58.

59.

60.

61.

62.

63.

64.

65.

reason of such non-payment on or before some day to be named in the notice (such day not
being less than fourteen days from the date of service of such notice) and at some places
(either the Office or a Bank) named in such notice, and that the shares in respect of which
the call was made or installment is payable will be liable to be forfeited.

If the requisitions of such notice are not compiled with, any share in respect of which such
notice has been given may at any time thereafter, before payment of calls, installments,
Interest and expenses due in respect thereof, may be forfeited by a resolution of the Board
of Directors, and the forfeiture shall be recorded in the Directors Minutes Book, Register of
Members and the holder of such share shall thereupon cease to have any interest therein,
and his name shall be removed from the register and thereupon notice shall be given to him
of such removal and an entry of the forfeiture with the date thereof shall forthwith; be made
in the register, but no forfeiture shall be in any manner invalidated by any commission or
neglect to give such notice to or to made such entry aforesaid.

The forfeiture of a share shall involve the extinction of all interest in and also of all claims
and demands against the Company in respect of the share and all other rights incidental to
the share, except only such of those rights as by these Articles are expressly saved.

Any person whose shares shall be so forfeited shall cease to be member in respect of the
forfeited share, but shall, not withstanding the forfeiture, be liable to pay and shall forthwith
pay to the Company all calls for installments, interest and expenses owing upon or in
respect of such share at the time of forfeiture together with interest at the rate of 18 percent
per annum, or at such rate as the Directors may determine. The liability of such person
shall cease if and when the Company shall have, received payment in full of all such
amounts due in respect of the shares.

Any share so forfeited shall be deemed to be the property of the Company and the board of
Directors may sell, re-allot or otherwise dispose off the same in such manner as they think
fit.

The Directors may at any time, before any share so forfeited shall have been sold, re-allot or
annul the forfeiture thereof upon such conditions as they think fit.

A duly verified declaration in writing that the declarant is a Director or the Secretary of the
Company, and that a share in the Company has been duly forfeited on a date stated in the
declaration, shall be conclusive evidence for the fact s therein stated as against all persons
claiming to be entitled to the share.

Shares which are fully paid up, shall be free from all lien and in the case of partly paid
shares, the Company shall have a lien which shall be restricted to moneys called or payable
at a fixed time in respect of such shares. The Company's lien if any, on a share shall extend
to all dividends payable thereon.

The Board shall be entitled to give effect to such lien by sale or forfeiture and re-issue of
the shares subject thereto or by retaining all dividends and profits in respect thereof or by
any combination of the said means but no sale or forfeiture shall be made, until such period
as aforesaid shall have arrived, and unless a sum in respect of which the lien exists is

25
66.

67.

68.

69.

70.

XI.

presently payable and until notice m writing of the intention to sell or forfeit shall have
served on such member, his executors or administrators, and default shall have been made
by him or by them in the payment, fulfillment or discharge of such debts, liabilities or
engagements for seven days after such notice.

i) The net proceeds of the sale shall be received by the Company and applied in payment of
such part of the amount in respect of which the lien exists, as is presently payable.

ii) The residue, if any subject to a like lien for sums presently payable as existed upon the
shares before the sale, be paid to the person entitled to the shares at the date of the sale, or
to his executors, administrators, committee, curator or other representatives.

Upon any sale after forfeiture or for enforcing a lien in purported exercise of the power
herein before given, the Directors may cause the purchaser's name to be entered in the
register in respect of the shares sold, and the purchaser shall not be bound to see to the
regularity of the proceedings or to the application of the purchase money and after his name
has been entered in the register in respect of such shares, the validity of the sale shall not be
impeached by any person.

Upon any sale or other disposal under the provisions of the preceding Article, the certificate
or certificates originally issued in respect of the relative shares shall (unless the same shall
on demand by the Company have been previously surrendered to it by the defaulting
member) stand cancelled and become null and void and of no effect and the Directors shall
be entitled to issue a duplicate certificate in respect of the said shares to the Person or
Persons entitled thereto.

Where any shares under the power in that behalf of herein contained are sold by the
Directors and the certificate thereof has not been delivered to the Company by the former
holders of the said shares, distinguishing it in such manner as they think fit from the
certificate not so delivered up, they may, issue fresh certificate.

Subject to the provisions of the Act and these Articles, the Board may accept from any

member the surrender, on such terms and conditions as shall be agreed, of all or any of his
shares.
