trusts for the Persons entitled thereto as may seem expedient to the Directors,
and generally may make such arrangement for the acceptance, allotment and
sale of such shares, debentures, debenture stock, bonds or other obligations and
fractional certificates or otherwise as they may think fit.

(5) When deemed requisite, a proper contract shall be filed in accordance with the
Act and the Board may appoint any Person to sign such contract on behalf of
the Members entitled, as aforesaid and such appointment shall be effective.

(6) Subject to the provisions the Act and these Articles, in cases where some of the
shares of the Company are fully paid and others are partly paid such
capitalization may be effected by the distribution of further shares in respect of
the fully paid shares and by crediting the partly paid shares with the whole or
part of the unpaid liability there on, but so that as between the holders of the
fully paid shares and the partly paid shares the sums so applied in the payment
of such further shares and in the extinguishments or diminution of the liability
on the partly paid shares shall be appointed prorata in proportion to the amount
then already paid or credited as paid in the existing fully paid and partly paid
shares respectively.

RESERVES AND DEPRECIATION FUNDS.

Subject to these Articles, the Directors may from time to time set apart any and such
portion of the profits of the Company as they think fit, as reserve fund at their discretion for
the liquidation of any debentures, debts or other liabilities of the Company, for equalization
of dividends or for any other purposes of the Company, with full power to employ the assets
constituting the Reserve Fund in the business of the Company and without being bound to
keep the same separate from the other assets.

Subject to these Articles, the Directors may also carry forward any profits which they
may think prudent not to divide without setting them aside as a reserve.

. Subject to these Articles, the Directors may from time to time set apart any such portion
of the profits of the Company as they think fit, as a Depreciation Fund at the discretion of
the Directors, for rebuilding, restoring, replacing, or altering any part of the building, works,
Plant, machinery or other property of the Company destroyed or damaged by fire, flood,
storms, tempest, accident, riot, wear and tear or other means, or for repairing altering and
keeping in good condition, the property of the Company or for extending and enlarging the
building, machinery and property of the Company, with full power to employ the assets
constituting such depreciation fund in the business of the Company and that without being
bound to keep the same separate from the other assets.

Subject to these Articles, all money carried to the Reserve Fund and Depreciation Fund
respectively shall nevertheless remain and be profits of the Company applicable, subject to
duel provision being made for actual loss or depreciation, for the payment of dividends and
such money and all the other monies of the Company, not immediately required for the
purpose of the Company, may be invested by the Board of Directors in or upon such

56
investments or securities, as they may select or may be used as working capital or may be
kept at any bank in deposit or otherwise as they may from time to time think proper.

(E) DIVIDENDS

170. Subject to these Articles, the Company in Annual General meeting may declare a
dividend to be paid to the members according to their rights and interests in the profits and
for the purpose of the equalization of dividends any sums from time to time in accordance
with these provisions carried to the reserves, depreciation or other special funds may be
applied in payment, thereof. The dividends so declared by the General body, shall not
exceed the amount so recommended by the Directors.

171. Subject to the rights of person, if any, entitled to such shares with special rights as to
dividends, all dividends shall be declared and paid according to the amounts paid up or
credited as paid on the shares in respect whereof the dividends is paid.

172 When any share holder is indebted to the Company for calls or, otherwise, all dividends
payable to him or a sufficient part thereof may be retained and applied by the Directors in
or towards satisfaction of the debt, liabilities or engagements.

173 No dividend shall be declared or paid by the Company for any financial year, except out
of the profits of the year or any other undistributed profits and no larger dividend shall be
declared than is recommended by the Directors, but the Company in General Meeting may
declare a smaller dividend. Before declaring any dividend, the Company shall have regard
to the provisions of Section 205 of the Act.

174. Subject to these Articles, where, owing to inadequacy or absence of profits in any year,
the Company proposes to declare dividend out of the accumulated profits ceamed by it in the
previous years and transferred to reserves, such declaration of dividend shall not be made
except in accordance with such rules as may be made in that behalf by the Government, and
where any such declaration is not in accordance with such rules, it shall not be made except
with the previous approval of the Government.

175 Subject to the provisions of Section 208 of the Act, the Company may pay interest on
so much of the share capital as is for the time being paid up, for the period and subject to
the conditions and restrictions mentioned in Section 208 and charge the sum so paid by way
of interest, to the capital as a part of cost of construction of the work, building or the
provision of the plant.

176 No dividend shall be payable except in cash provided that nothing shall be, deemed to
prohibit the capitalization of profits or reserves of the Company for the purpose of issuing
fully paid up bonus shares, subject to these Articles or paying up any amount for the time
being unpaid on any shares held by the members of the Company.

177 In case two or more persons are registered as the joint holders of any share, any of such

persons may give effectual receipts for all dividends and payments on account of dividends
in respect of such share.

57
178 Any Annual General meeting declarmg dividend, may make a call on the members of
such amount as the meeting fixed so that the call on each member shall not exceed the
dividend payable to him and and so that the call be made payable at the same time as the
dividend and the dividend may, if so be arranged between the Company and the member be
set off against the call.

179. A transfer of shares shall not pass the right to any dividend declared thereon before the
registration of the transfer unless agreed otherwise between the parties.

180 Unless otherwise directed by the Company in General Meeting any dividend may be
paid in cash or by cheque or warrant or money order sent through the post within forty two
days of the date of such declaration to the registered address of the member entitled or in
the case of joint holders to the registered address of that on whose name stands first on the
register in respect of the joint holding and every cheque so sent shall be made payable to the
order of the person to whom it is sent.

181 All dividends on any share not having a legal registered owner entitled to require
payment of and competent to give a valid receipt for the same shall remain in suspense until
some competent person be registered as the holder of the share. Provided that the dividends
unclaimed shall be dealt with in accordance with the provisions of Section 205A of the Act.

XXV. WINDING UP

182 Subject to these Articles and the rights attached to the Preference Shares, the Liquidator
on any winding-up (whether voluntary, under supervision or compulsory) may, with the
sanction of a Special Resolution, , divide among the contributories in specie any part of the
assets of the Company and may, with like sanction, vest any part of the assets of the
Company in trustees upon such trusts for the benefit of the contributories as the liquidator,
with the like sanction, shall think fit.

XXVI. SECRECY

183 Every Director, Manager, Trustee, Member of a Committee, Officer, Servant, Agent
Accountant, or other persons employed in the business of the Company shall if so required
by the Directors or Managing Agents sign a declaration pledging himself to observe a strict
secrecy respecting all transactions of the Company with its customers and the state of
accounts with individuals and in matters relating thereto and shall by such declaration
pledge himself not to reveal any of the matters which may come to his knowledge in the
discharge of his duties except when required so to do by the Directors or by any meeting or
by a court of law and except so far as may be necessary in order to comply with any of the
provisions in these provisions contained.

184 Subject to these Articles, no member or other person (not being a Director) shall be
entitled to enter the property of the Company or to inspect or examine the Company*s
premises or properties of the Company without the permission of the directors of the
company for the time being to require discovery of any information respecting any detail of
the Company's trading or any matter subject to these Articles, no Member shall be entitled
to visit or inspect any works of the Company without the permission of the Directors or to

58
require discovery of or any information respecting any detail of the Company's trading, or
any matter which is or may be in nature of trade secret, mystery of trade, secret process or
any other matter which may relate to the conduct the business of the Company and which in
the opinion of the directors, it would be inexpedient in the interest of the Company to
disclose..

XXVII. INDEMNITY

185

Every Director, Auditor, Secretary, Agent and Officer of the Company, shall also be
indemnified out of the assets of the Company against any liability incurred by him in
defending any proceedings whether civil or criminal, in which the judgment is given in his
favour or in which he is acquitted or in connection with any application under Section 633
of the Act in which relief is granted to him by the Court.

XXVIII. MISCELLANEOUS

186.

— — Information Rights
(a) The Company shall furnish to the Investors the following information:

(1) Within ninety (90) days after the end of each Financial Year, (A)
audited annual financial statements prepared in accordance with the
Accounting Principles and certified by the Auditors and (B) a copy of a
management letter delivered by the Auditor;

(ii) Within thirty (30) days after the end of each fiscal quarter, internal
quarterly financial statements for the Company, prepared in accordance
with the Accounting Principles;

(iii) Within thirty (30) days after the end of each fiscal month, (A) internal
monthly income and cash flow statements prepared in accordance with
the Accounting Principles, (B) monthly cash burn rate and ending cash
balance, and (C) any other material financial or accounting information,
including correspondence with the Auditors;

(iv) By no later than forty-five (45) days before commencement of each
Financial Year, the proposed annual Business Plan and budgets of the
Company and other information as may be reasonably requested;

(v) Prompt notice of any Material Adverse Effect or Significant Adverse
Effect; and

(vi) Insurance certificates and other insurance information.
(b) The Investors shall receive timely copies of all management letters of

accountants, notification of material litigation, and notification of all material filings
made with the regulatory agencies.

59
187

188

 

(c) Without prejudice to the aforesaid, the Investors and their respective counsel,
accountants and other representatives shall be given full access, upon reasonable notice,
during normal business hours to all of the facilities, properties, books, tax retums and
records of the Company and its Subsidiaries and all personnel of the Company and they
shall be furnished with such documents and information with respect to the affairs of
the Company as may from time to time reasonably be requested.

(d) The Investors shall have the right to be kept informed and consult with the
management of the Company with regard to any material developments in or affecting
the Company”s business, to discuss business operations, properties and the financial or
other condition of the Company with its officers, employees and Directors, to consult
with and advise the management on significant business issues and to regularly meet
with the management during each year for such consultation and advice.

(e) Notvwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the Investors shall
have the right to inspect the books and records of the Company and shall have the right
to appoint a qualified accountant to inspect the Company*s accounting records at such
reasonable times and as often as the Investors may reasonably request.

ESOP:

In order to attract talented officers and employees for the Company and in order to provide
such employees with incentives to ensure their continued association with the Company, the
Company may maintain and supplement or replace an employee stock option plan (the
"ESOP") with the approval of each of the Investors as set out in these Articles and in
accordance with the following criteria:

(a) The Company may reserve such number of Common Shares for allotment to
employees of the Company pursuant to the ESOP (the "ESOP Shares"), such that the ESOP
Shares shall, on a fully diluted basis including the Investor Shares represent up to five
percent (5%) of the outstanding Common Shares as of the Effective Date;

(b) The Board's compensation committee shall establish reasonable criteria and
pricing for grants of Common Shares pursuant to the ESOP, including performance criteria
to the extent consistent with favorable tax treatment of the Company.

(c) The Company shall not establish or maintain any stock option plan or similar

equity based compensation arrangement other than as set forth above in this Article, except
with the consent of the Investors

— asurance Covenants
Each of the Promoters shall cause the Company to:

(a) insure and keep insured on terms and conditions acceptable to each of the
Investors, with a reputable insurer or insurers all of the Company's assets and business

which can be insured, against insurable losses, on a reinstatement basis utilizing current full
replacement values, including insurance covers listed in Schedule 1 to the Shareholders

60
Agreement, and any other insurance required by law. lhe policies shall be in the English
language;

(b) punctually pay any premium, commission and any other amount necessary for
effecting and maintaining in force each insurance policy;

(c) not do or omit to do, or permit to be done or not done, anything which might
prejudice the Company's right to claim or recover under any insurance policy;

(d) promptly notify the relevant insurer of any claim by the Company under any
policy written by that insurer and diligently pursue that claim; and

(e) at either Investor's request, submit relevant documentation evidencing
insurances in place.

189.  — Enviroumental Covenants

Each of the Promoters shall cause the Company to, and the Company shall:

(a) comply with all applicable environmental, health and fire and life safety
legislation and standards of the countries in which the Company operates, as well as the
Environmental Health and Safety Guidelines, the Environmental and Social Policies and
any applicable World Bank Group environmental, health, fire and safety guidelines;

(b) appoint and maintain a technically qualified individual to the position of
responsibility for environmental management of the Company's facilities;

(c) comply with the ameliorative statements and commitments set forth in the ERS,
including the completion of all commitments and technical activities described therein
within one (1) year from the Effective Date;

(d) develop a Corrective Action Plan satisfactory to IFC with an implementation
schedule in accordance with the requirements of the ERS within six (6) months of the
Effective Date, and complete and/or deliver to IFC all items set forth in such Corrective
Action Plan to IFC's satisfaction on or before the date stipulated in such Corrective Action
Plan;

(e) collect adequate data throughout each Financial Year to facilitate the
completion and submittal of the Annual Monitoring Report, and within thirty (30) days after
the end of each Financial Year, deliver to IFC an Annual Monitoring Report, in form and
substance satisfactory to IFC; provided the Company may supplement any Annual
Monitoring Report with such information as may be useful to enhance its clarity and/or to
better illustrate the Company's performance over time (e.g., charts, graphs);

(f) deliver to IFC quarterly progress reports to demonstrate compliance with the
Corrective Action Plan;

(g) as soon as possible but no later than three (3) days after its occurrence, notify
the Investors of any incident or accident which has or may reasonably be expected to have

61
an adverse effect on the environment, health or safety, including explosions, spills or
workplace accidents which result in death, serious or multiple injury or major pollution,
specifying, in each case, the nature of the incident or accident, the on-site and off-site
impacts arising or likely to arise therefrom and the measures the Company is taking or plans
to take to address those impacts; and keep the Investors informed of the on-going
implementation of those measures;

(h) not amend the ERS without IFC's prior written consent.

190. Prohibited Payments and Activities

(a) None of the Promoters or the Company, or any of their respective Affiliates, or
any Person acting on any of their behalf, shall make with respect to the Project or any
transaction contemplated by the Shareholders Agreement, any Prohibited Payment.

(b) None of the Company and the Promoters shall make (nor shall authorize or
permit any Affiliate or any other Person acting on its behalf to make) with respect to the Project
or any transaction contemplated by the Shareholders Agreement, any Prohibited Payment.

(c) The Promoters shall cause the Company to institute, maintain and comply with
appropriate internal procedures and controls in compliance with Applicable Laws of India, for
the purpose of preventing any Promoter or the Company or any of their respective Affiliates
from being used for money laundering, the financing of terrorist activity, fraud, or other corrupt
or illegal purposes or practices; and ensure that none of the Promoters nor the Company will
enter into any transaction with, or for the benefit of, any individuals or institutions named on
lists of sanctioned persons promulgated by the United Nations Security Counsel or its
committees per Security Council Resolution 1267 (1999), 1373 (2001) in connection with
money laundering or anti-terrorism matters.

191 -Affirmative Covenants
The Company shall:
(a) use the proceeds of the Investor Subscriptions solely for capacity expansion,

marketing, new product development and such other purposes as may be approved by both of
the Investors;

(b) undertake its business, activities and investments in compliance with
Applicable Laws;
(c) undertake all clinical trials of its products that are subject to Applicable Laws in

accordance with the Ethical Guidelines for Biomedical Research on Human Subjects (the ICMR
Code) as adopted by the Indian Council on Medical Research and will strive to undertake all
clinical trials of its products in accordance with the International Ethical Guidelines for
Biomedical Research Involving Human Subjects as adopted by the Council for International
Organizations of Medical Sciences (CIOMS) in collaboration with the World Health
Organization (WHO); and

62
(d) adopt and maintain a policy, in form and substance satisfactory to the Investors,
designed to maximize its ownership of intellectual property developed or acquired in the course
of its operations.

192. Negative Covenants

Unless each of the Investors otherwise agrees, the Company shall not:

(a) use the proceeds of the Investor Subscription to repay any outstanding
indebtedness of the Company or redeem or repurchase any Shares or Share Equivalents.

193 Voting Arrangements

Each of the Promoters shall until the earlier of redemption of the Preferred Shares or conversion
of the Preferred Shares into Common Shares, vote in accordance with the instructions of each
Investor at a General Meeting or provide proxies without instructions to the Investors for the
purposes of a General Meeting, in respect of such number of Common Shares held by each of
them such that X% (X percent) of the Common Shares of the Company are voted on in the
manner required by each Investor (provided, for the avoidance of doubt, the Investors may act
in concert or separately with respect to such voting instructions); provided X percent shall be
equal to the percentage of Common Shares in the Company that each Investor would hold if it
were to elect to convert its Preferred Shares into Common Shares.

194 Certain Remedies

In the event of: (i) any breach of the Transaction Documents which has had or could reasonably
be expected to have a Significant Adverse Effect, (ii) the findings of any audit or investigation
by the Investors reveals that Company funds have been improperly manipulated or diverted by
the Promoters in a manner which has had or could reasonably be expected to have a Significant
Adverse Effect, (iii) the management of the Company having been conducted, in an unlawful,
improper or fraudulent manner which has had or could reasonably be expected to have a
Significant Adverse Effect, (iv) the willful and repeated breach by any of the Promoter
Directors of their fiduciary obligations to the Company in a manner having a Significant
Adverse Effect; or (v) in the reasonable opinion of the Investors, the existence or likely
occurrence of any event or circumstance that threatens or is likely to have a Significant Adverse
Effect on the Company, the Investors (acting jointly) shall, in additional to any and all remedies
available to the Investors pursuant to Applicable Law, have the right to:

a) appoint such additional number of Directors to the Board so as to constitute a
majority in favor of the Investors;

b) appoint and change the chief executive officer, chief financial officer, Company
management, Directors;

e) require the Board to cause spin off or sale of assets and/or businesses of the
Company;
d) determine and/or change the Business Plan and strategy of the Company:

63
e) bring in new investors;
9) determine utilization of surplus cash;

89 take steps to cause, merger, acquisition or take-over of the Company or for
expansion or diversification of the activities of the Company;

h) Cause the Company to redeem their shares at the Redemption Price; and

i) Take any other commercially appropriate action to protect their investment;
(the foregoing rights, collectively, the " Affirmative Rights").

The Investors shall be able to undertake such Affirmative Rights without any undertaking, duty
or liability to any other Shareholder or creditor of the Company: provided, that any Investor
having a material conflict of interest shall disclose it to the other Investor and with respect to
any such disclosed matter shall not be entitled to exercise Affirmative Rights with respect
thereto. The exercise of any Affirmative Rights by the Investors shall be at the sole cost and
expense of the Company.

195. Non-Compete

(a) Each of the Promoters shall grant a first option to the Company by notice in
writing to the Board of Directors to exploit future proposals in respect of business opportunities
related to the present business of the Company on arms length terms. The interested Promoter(s)
shall recluse himself/themselves from any vote of the Board of Directors with respect to such
opportunity. In the event that the Company does not convey its written acceptance of any
opportunity to exploit as aforesaid on terms offered in writing by the Promoter(s) within a
period of sixty (60) Business Days of such offer being received, the Promoter(s) shall be
entitled to exploit such opportunity either directly or through an arrangement with any third
party on terms no more favourable than those offered to the Company.

(b) Notwithstanding the provisions of (a) above, the Company shall be the
Promoter's (and their respective family member's) exclusive vehicle for undertaking any
business similar or identical to the business carried on by the Company and shall not:

(1) either, directly or indirectly, compete with the Company in relation to
its business;

(ii) disclose, directly or indirectly in whatsoever manner to a third party,
any confidential or proprietary information in regard to the business
and workings of the Company of which it has knowledge or has
acquired knowledge during the period the business is carried on by the
Company.

(c) No activities of the Promoters of the Company and those of any Person in
which it holds any interest, shall compete with the business of the Company.

B. CONFIDENCIALIDADE E PUBLICIDADE.
B.1. Obrigações de Não Divulgação e Não Uso - Em todos os momentos durante a
igência deste MOU e pelo período de 03 (três) anos após a rescisão ou expiração
deste, cada Parte deverá, e deverá fazer com que seus administradores, diretores,
colaboradores e agentes, não divulguem e não usem nenhuma Informação Confidencial
fornecida ou de outra forma dada a eles pela outra Parte, exceto na medida em que tal
divulgação ou-uso seja expressamente permitido pela termos deste. MOU ou seja
razoavelmente necessário para o desempenho deste MOU. As obrigações de
confidencialidade deverão sobreviver com relação aos segredos comerciais na medida
em que à Parte Divulgadora, detentora dos segredos comerciais, classifique para as
outras Partes nã notificação prévia por escrito que tais Informações Confidenciais
serão tratadas como “segredo comercial”, e tais Informações Confidenciais mantêm
seu status de segredo comercial. Nenhuma das Partes deverá fazer qualquer uso não
permitido das Informações Confidenciais sema autorização prévia por escrito
específica da parte divulgadora.
B.2. Informações Confidenciais - Todas as informações, sejam orais, escritas,
igráficas, eletrônicas ou outra forma (incluindo) cópias dessas), incluindo, mas não se
limitando a informações, dados, segredos: comerciais, fórmulas, processos, ideias de
(produtos, know-how, amostra ou modelo, que é divulgada por ou em nome de uma
Parte (a “Parte Divulgadora”) à outra Parte (a “Parte Receptora”) nos termos deste
Contrato, deverão ser consideradas como sendo “Informações Confidenciais”. Para os
ffins deste MOU, “Informações Confidenciais” significam toda e qualquer informação
ou material de uma Parte, incluindo, mas não se limitando aos termos deste MOU ou
informações ou material relacionado ao segredo comercial, know-how, dossiê do

este Contrato por qualquer Parte divulgar quaisquer Informações Confidenciais em
onsonância a uma ordem de tribunal ou um pedido vinculativo de uma autoridade
statutária ou regulatória (ou outra autoridade similar) com jurisdição para exigir a
ivulgação de tais informações, desde que a Parte Receptora forneça todas as
otificações razoáveis por escrito com antecedência sobre tal divulgação para a outra
arte, dando oportunidade razoável para revisar a divulgação antes que esta seja feita e
interpor sua própria objeção à divulgação e limitar a divulgação na medida necessária
ara atender a tal solicitação.
-3. Publicações - Cada Parte deverá ter o direito de apresentar, publicar e de outra
orma publicamente divulgar informações que desenvolveu ou descobriu em atividades
onjuntas, desde que (a) não divulgue qualquer Informação Confidencial da outra Parte
m tal, divulgação (exceto conforme expressamente permitido de acordo com o
resente); e (b) forneça à“outra Parte cópias antecipadas de cada divulgação proposta
elo menos 30 (trinta) dias antes da submissão para apresentação, publicação ou outra
divulgação. A pedido da Parte não publicadora dentro de tal período de 30 (trinta) dias,
a publicação será retida por mais 30 (trinta) dias. Cada Parte receberá crédito, se
solicitado, por escrito para seu apoio na descoberta ou desenvolvimento da informação.
Os direitos sobre a autoria deverão ser determinados pelos modos aceitáveis, conforme
raticados nos direitos de publicação.
3.4. Uso do nome da Parte - Nenhuma das Partes pode usar o nome da outra parte em
aterial de propaganda ou de publicidade, nem em qualquer outra publicação ou fazer
eclaração ou afirmação sem primeiro ter obtido a permissão por escrito da outra
arte. Nenhuma das Partes deverá emitir qualquer comunicado à imprensa ou outra
eclaração pública concernente a este MOU ou a outras atividades conjuntas sem o
onsentimento prévio por escrito da outra Parte.

8.5. Devolução das Informações Confidenciais - Todas as cópias, incluindo, mas não
se limitando a notas, dossiê de produto, relatórios, dados de ensaios clínicos e outros
instrumentos escritos. impressos ou outros materiais tangíveis, sejam documentados ou
Armazenados por escrito, gráficos, eletrônicos, magnéticos ou qualquer outra forma de
informação Confidencial, deverão ser destruídas ou devolvidas à Parte Divulgadora
mediante pedido, expiração ou rescisão antecipada deste Contrato a qualquer
momento, e em qualquer caso, não mais tardar do que 30 (trinta) dias após a expiração
bu rescisão deste Contrato, exceto que a Parte Receptora possa reter uma cópia das
nformações Confidenciais para fins de arquivamento jurídico. Todas as Informações
Confidenciais de uma Parte Divulgadora (incluindo todas as suas cópias) deverão ser a
odos os momentos de propriedade de tal Parte Divulgadora.
B.6. Propriedade - Informações Confidenciais (incluindo todas as cópias destas)
divulgadas pela Parte Divulgadora de acordo com o presente deverão permanecer
como sendo propriedade de tal Parte Divulgadora. Nada neste Contrato deverá ser
interpretado. por implicação ou de outra forma, como uma concessão, cessão,
arrendamento, hipoteca de qualquer direito ou licença das Informações Confidenciais,
jmarcas registradas, invenções, direitos autorais ou patentes, como uma concessão de
Juma licença para a Parte Receptora usar quaisquer das Informações Confidenciais da
Parte Divulgadora, exceto conforme expressamente definido no presente, ou como
uma obrigação para celebrar quaisquer outros contratos relacionados a qualquer
Informações. Confidenciais ou qualquer eventual relação comercial.
B.7. Dano Irreparável - As Partes reconhecem e concordam expressamente que
qualquer divulgação, em violação deste Contrato, das Informações pela Parte
Receptora destas poderia ser prejudicial para os negócios da Parte Divulgadora e pode
causar prejuízos e danos irreparáveis. De acordo com a lei aplicável e além de
quaisquer outros direitos e recursos previstos no presente, tal Parte Divulgadora deverá
er o direito de buscar recurso em equidade por meio de ordem judicial ou de outra
forma.
4. RESPONSABILIDADE E INDENIZAÇÃO.
4.1. Declarações Mútuas - Cada uma das Partes declara e garante à outra Parte que (a)
tem o»poder e autoridade necessários para celebrar este MOU e para agir de acordo
com seus termos, e que o funcionário que assina este MOU tem autoridade para fazê-
o; (b) a execução, entrega e desempenho pela Parte deste MOU não infringe e não irá
infringir ou entrar em conflito com os documentos estatutários da Parte ou quaisquer
eis aplicáveis, ou constituem: uma inadimplência em qualquer aspecto material de
ualquer contrato ou instrumento da qual a Parte é uma parte; e (c) é financeiramente
apaz de satisfazer todos os compromissos de financiamento assumidos em quaisquer
tividades conjuntas.
-2. TERMO DE RESPONSABILIDADE DE DECLARAÇÕES E GARANTIAS
EXCETO PARA AS DECLARAÇÕES E GARANTIAS PREVISTAS NA SEÇÃO
-1 DESTE MOU, NENHUMA DAS PARTES FAZ QUALQUER DECLARAÇÃO
U CONCEDE QUALQUER GARANTIA, DE ACORDO COM O PRESENTE,
ARA A OUTRA PARTE, SEJA EXPRESSA OU IMPLÍCITA, QUANTO A
UALQUER QUESTÃO QUE SEJA.

QUALQUER DAS PARTES DEVERÁ SER RESPONSÁVEL POR DANOS

DECORRENTE DE QUALQUER VIOLAÇÃO DE OU FALHA EM EXECUTAR
QUALQUER UMA DAS DISPOSIÇÕES DESTE MOU.

5. LEI VIGENTE E RESOLUÇÃO DE LITÍGIOS.

p.1. Lei Vigente - Este MOU deverá ser regido e interpretado de acordo com as leis da
ndia.

P.2 Arbitragem - Qualquer litígio ou controvérsia decorrente deste MOU que não
possa ser resolvido amigavelmente pelas Partes, deverá ser resolvido por arbitragem
inculativa nos termos da Lei de Arbitragem e Conciliação de 1996. O local da
arbitragem deverá ser em Hyderabad, Índia. Nada em esta Seção 5.2 deverá impedir
hualquer das Partes de buscar medidas de reparação interinas ou provisórias, incluindo
uma ordem de restrição temporária, liminar ou outro recurso em equidade interino,
poncernente a um litígio, antes ou durante qualquer arbitragem, se necessário, a fim de
proteger os interesses de tal Parte.

b. DIREITOS DE PROPRIEDADE INTELECTUAL.

6.1 Definições:-

a) “Invenção” significa qualquer descoberta, conceito ou ideia, patenteável ou não, e
Hecorrente diretamente do desempenho do Propósito nos termos deste MOU,
incluindo, mas não limitado a processos; métodos, software, produtos de pesquisa
angíveis, fórmulas e técnicas, melhorias destes e know-how relacionado a estes.

b) “Direitos de Propriedade Intelectual” significa patentes, marcas registradas,
pomes comerciais, marcas de serviço, direitos autorais de nomes de domínio, segredo
Lomercial, know-how, material biológico natural, híbrido, recombinante 'e sintético e
melhorias e modificações nestes, direitos em e aos bancos de dados (incluindo direitos
para impedir a extração ou reutilização de informações de um banco de dados), direitos

He design, direitos de topografia e todos os direitos ou formas de proteção de natureza
Similar ou tendo efeito equivalente ou similar a qualquer um deles que possa subsistir
em qualquer parte do mundo, seja ou não alguns deles registrados/ concedidos e/ ou
podem incluir pedidos de registro de quaisquer deles ou não podem ter solicitado o
registro, mas ainda seriam considerados de modo a incluir como Propriedade
ntelectual.

c) “Know How” deverá significar todas as informações técnicas e outras que não estão
em público domínio (exceto como resultado. de uma quebra de confiança), incluindo,
mas não se limitando a informações compreendendo ou relacionadas a conceitos,
descobertas, dados, designs, fórmulas, ideias, invenções, métodos, modelos,
procedimentos, designs para experimentos e testes e resultados da experimentação e
este, processos, especificações e técnicas, registros laboratoriais, dados clínicos, dados
de fabricação e informações contidas em submissões a autoridades regulatórias,
protegidas ou não por Direitos de Propriedade Intelectual ou quaisquer pedidos para
tais direitos.

6.2 Cada Parte deverá permanecer sendo a única proprietária e tem direitos, títulos e
interesses exclusivos, em qualquer e todos os Direitos de Propriedade Intelectual, que
foram concebidos ou desenvolvidos. a qualquer momento, independentemente da outra
Parte nos termos deste MOU.

6.3 Todos os direitos, títulos e interesses em qualquer Invenção, Direitos de
Propriedade Intelectual concebidos, desenvolvidos e/ ou reduzidos à prática como um
resultado direto ou indireto do desempenho por qualquer uma das Partes nos termos
deste Contrato, deverão pertencer exclusivamente à BBIL. A BBIL deverá ser a única
responsável pelas despesas incorridas na apresentação, processo, emissão e/ ou
manutenção de qualquer pedido de patente ou emissão de patente neste âmbito.
Processos, litígios e custas adicionais, incluindo honorários advocatícios, se houver,
deverão ser posteriormente arcados pela BBIL. A Precisa e a Envixia deverão cooperar
com a BBIL, de boa-fé e no melhor de sua capacidade, a fim de substanciar com
documentos e informações, conforme seja necessário para a implementação bem-
pula, incluindo, sem limitação, procedimentos com documentação, processos e
itígios: N :

7. DISPOSIÇÕES GERAIS.

7.1. Renúncia:- Nenhuma falha ou atraso por parte de qualquer uma das partes no
exercício de qualquer direito, poder ou privilégio nos termos deste MOU funcionará
[como uma renúncia deste, nem qualquer o exercício único ou parcial de qualquer
direito, poder ou privilégio operará como uma renúncia de qualquer exercício.

7.2. Cessão - Sem o consentimento prévio por escrito da outra Parte, nenhuma das
Partes deverá vender, transferir, ceder, delegar, penhorar ou de outra forma alinear,
voluntariamente, involuntariamente, por força da lei ou de outra forma, este MOU ou
jqualquer um de seus direitos ou deveres de acordo com o presente ou neste âmbito.

7.3. Notificações - Todas as notificações nos termos deste MOU deverão ser feitas por
escrito e deverão ser consideradas dadas quando entregues pessoalmente ou quando
enviadas por fax, ou enviadas por e-mail confirmado ou enviadas por correio para o
endereço da parte definido neste MOU.

7.4 Contratados Independentes - A relação das Partes é a de contratados
independentes e não agentes uns dos outros ou joint ventures ou parceiros,
independentemente se uma ou ambas as Partes estabelecem um escritório na sede da
butra Parte. Cada Parte deverá manter o controle único e exclusivo sobre seu pessoal e
bperações. Nenhuma das Partes deverá ter o poder de vincular ou obrigar a outra Parte
He qualquer forma, incluindo em conexão com arrecadação de fundos, pedido de
subsídios, defesa e atividades relacionadas à política.

[7.5. MOU Definitivo — O presente MOU constitui o contrato definitivo entre as Partes
pertinentes ao assunto em questão do presente e substitui todos os contratos, orais ou
Escritos, entendimentos, negociações e discussões anteriores entre as Partes pertinentes
a tal assunto.

7.6. Aditamentos - Se qualquer uma das Partes desejar uma modificação ou extensão
deste MOU, a Parte deverá, mediante notificação razoável da modificação ou extensão
propostas, deliberar em boa-fé para determinar a conveniência de tal modificação ou
extensão. Tal modificação ou extensão não deverá ser efetiva até que um aditamento
por escrito seja executado pelos representantes devidamente autorizados de cada Parte.
[7.7. Autonomia das Cláusulas. No caso de qualquer disposição deste MOU ser
Considerada ilegal, inválida ou inexequível sob as leis atuais ou futuras, ela deverá ser
neficaz na medida de tal invalidade, ilegalidade ou inexequibilidade, sem afetar de
gualquer forma as disposições ou condições remanescentes deste MOU. As Partes
deverão permanecer legalmente vinculadas pelos demais termos deste MOU e deverão
se esforçar para emendar o MOU de uma forma consistente com a intenção original
das Partes.

[7.8 Força Maior. Se, a qualquer momento durante a existência deste MOU, qualquer
uma das partes for incapaz de cumprir total ou parcialmente qualquer de suas
Obrigações devido à guerra, hostilidade, operações militares de qualquer natureza, atos
Flo governo, sabotagem, incêndio, inundações, explosões, epidemias, greves e qualquer
putro assunto que esteja além do controle humano, então a data de qualquer obrigação
nos termos deste MOU deverá ser adiada durante o período em que tais circunstâncias
estiverem ocorrendo. 4

7.9. Vias; Assinatura via Fac-símile — O presente MOU pode ser assinado em 2
duas) ou mais vias, cada uma delas deverá ser considerada um original, mas todas elas
juntas deverão constituir um e o mesmo instrumento. Este MOU pode ser assinado por
fac-símile ou as assinaturas podem ser transmitidas eletronicamente e, tais assinaturas
Keverão ser consideradas de modo a vincular -cada Parte do presente como se estas
fossem as assinaturas originais.

Memorandum of Understanding

This Memorandum of Understanding [Hereinafter referred to as “MOU”] is entered into as of
24 day of November, 2020 (the “Effective Date”), by and between:

Bharat Biotech International Limited, a company incorporated as per the Companies Act,
1956, having its registered office situated at Genome Valley, Shameerpet, Hyderabad — 500
078, Telangana, India, (which term shall include its successors, and permitted assigns)
[Hereinafter referred to as “BBIL”], of the FIRST PART;

AND

Precisa Comercialização de Medicamentos Ltda, a company incorporated under the laws of
Brazil, having its registered office Av. Portugal, 1100 - Rua 5 Parte A 14 A-ltapevi, SP Cep:
06696-060, (hereinafter referred to as “PRECISA”), which term shall include its successors,
affiliates, subsidiaries and permitted assigns of the SECOND PART;

AND

Envixia Pharmaceuticals LLC, a company in International Free Zone Authority, Fujairah -
UAE having its registered office at Kidnah, Block A, Plot 4, Fujairah - UAE, (hereinafter
referred to as “Envixia”), which term shall include its successors, affiliates, subsidiaries and
permitted assigns of the THIRD PART;

hereinafter are also referred to, individually, as a “Party”, or, jointly, or cumulatively, as the
“Parties”.

WHEREAS, BBIL is a leading manufacturer of vaccines and bio-pharmaceuticals in India,
and has considerable technology, trade secret, know-how and research experience in relation
to the manufacturing and commercial production of vaccines and bio-therapeutics and has also

established its marketing and distribution network for such product(s) in India as well as
abroad;

AND WHEREAS, PRECISA is a company with more than 20 years of experience in the
Brazilian health market, specializing in importing and distributing large volumes of healtl

products as well as acting in an innovative way together with other major Brazilian
international companies.

 
 
  
 
  
 

AND WHEREAS, Envixia is well versed in Import and Trade of Medicines, Medical Devi:
and Equipment,

AND WHEREAS, the Parties wish to initiate discussion regarding business relationship fár
introduction of BBILs COVID-19 vaccine candidate COV AXINTM, in Brazil [Hereinafte
referred to as the “Purpose”).

AND WHERAS, each Party acknowledges that for the effective performance under this

bs 7&

>"

  
Agreement and for the smooth functioning of the Purpose, each Party requires to oblige with
the commitments made under this MOU to the best of its capacity in utmost good faith.

AND WHERAS, the Parties wish to assure the protection and preservation of certain
confidential and/or proprietary information to be disclosed or made available by or on behalf
of one party to the other party in the course of their discussions (including strategic,
commercial, clinical or scientific), if any, or in discussions concerning an eventual
collaboration (including, without limitation, technical, strategic, commercial, clinical or
scientific) between them.

AND NOW, THEREFORE, in view of the mutual premises and covenants contained herein
and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby
acknowledged, AND INTENDING TO BE LEGALLY BOUND the Parties agree as follows:

1. TERMS OF THE MOU

1.1. Collaboration- Presica, Envixia and BBIL hereby agree to this MOU, under which the
Parties intend to collaborate with respect to the Purpose. The Parties” mutual obligations
under such collaboration shall be as set forth herein as Schedule 1 to this Agreement.

2. TERM AND TERMINATION

2.1. Term - This MOU shall become effective as of the Effective Date and shall be effective
for Two (02) years from the Effective Date, unless both Parties agree to extend the
MOU in writing or unless terminated earlier by either Party under Section 2.2 of this
Agreement.

2.2. Termination of this MOU - Either Party may terminate this MOU for any reason or
for no reason upon Thirty (30) days” written notice to the other Party.

3. CONFIDENTIALITY AND PUBLICITY

3.1. Nondisclosure and Non-use Obligations - At all times during the term of this MOU
and for a period of three (03) years following termination or expiration hereof, each
Party shall, and shall cause its officers, directors, employees and agents, to not disclose
and not use any Confidential Information provided or otherwise made known to it by
the other Party, except to the extent such disclosure or use is expressly permitted by the
terms of this MOU or is reasonably necessary for the performance of this MOU. The
Confidentiality obligations shall survive with respect to trade secrets so long as the
Disclosing Party owning the trade secrets places the other Parties on written prior notice
that such Confidential Information shall be treated as “trade secret”, and such
Confidential Information retains its trade secret status. No Party shall make any non-
permitted use of the Confidential Information without the disclosing party's specific
prior written authorization. |

 
 
    
 

3.2. Confidential Information - All information, whether in oral, written, graph
electronic or other form (including copies thereof), including, but not limited
information, data, trade secrets, formulas, processes, product ideas, know-how, |é
sample or model, that is disclosed by or on behalf of a Party (the “Disclosing Party
to the other Party (the “Receiving Party”) under this Agreement, shall be deemed tó
be “Confidential Information”. For purposes of this MOU, “Confidential
Information” means any and all any and all information or material of a Party,

bi; q

>

 
including but not limited to the terms of this MOU or information or material relating
to thetrade-secret, know-how, product dossier, patent (whether application or granted),
trademarks, intellectual property (whether or not protectable), clinical trial
data/information, reports, scientific, regulatory or business information or other activity
of either Party that is disclosed to the other Party in connection with this MOU in
writing or in any form or media (or orally or visually) whether or not marked
confidential. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information shall not include
any information that:

3.2.1. isor becomes part of the public domain through no wrongful act, fault or negligence
on the part of the receiving Party;

3.2.2. is available from other sources who are not under any obligation of confidentiality
with respect to the information;

3.2.3. has been made available by the providing Party to others without any obligation of
confidentiality;

3.2.4. is already in the possession of the receiving Party at the time of disclosure, as
evidenced by documentation or other competent evidence; or

3.2.5. has been independently developed by or for the receiving Party without reference
to the providing Party's Confidential Information, as evidenced by documentation
or other competent evidence.

Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Agreement it shall not be a breach of this
Agreement for any Party to disclose any Confidential Information pursuant to a court
order or a binding request from a statutory or regulatory (or other analogous) authority
with jurisdiction to require the disclosure of such Information, provided that the
Receiving Party gives all reasonable notice(s) in writing in advance, of such disclosure
to the other Party, provide reasonable opportunity to review the disclosure before it is
made and to interpose its own objection to the disclosure and limits the disclosure to
the extent necessary to comply with such request.

3.3. Publications - Each Party shall have the right to present, publish and otherwise publicly
disclose information it has developed or discovered in joint activities provided that (a)
it does not disclose any Confidential Information of the other Party in such disclosure
(except as expressly permitted hereunder); and (b) it provides the other Party with
advance copies of each such proposed disclosure at least thirty (30) days before the
submission for presentation, publication or other disclosure. Upon request by the non-
publishing Party within such thirty (30) day period, the publication will be withheld for
an additional thirty (30) days. Each Party will receive credit, if requested, in writing for
its support in the discovery or development of the information. The rights over the
authorship shall be determined by the acceptable modes as practiced for publication
rights.

  
  

3.4. Use of Party's Name - Neither Party may use the name of the other Party in âny
advertising or publicity material nor in any other publication or make representatior)lor
statement without first having obtained the other Party*s written permission. Nei
Party shall issue any press release or other public statement concerning this MOL
other joint activities without the prior written consent of the other Party.

3.5. Return of Confidential Information - All copies, including but not limited to notes)
product dossier, reports, clinical trial data and other written, printed or other tangible

bi; q

>

 
3.6.

3.7.

materials, whether documented or stored in written, graphic, electronic, magnetic or
any other form, of Confidential Information shall be destroyed or retumed to the
Disclosing Party upon request or upon expiration or at early termination of this
Agreement at any time, and in any event, no later than Thirty (30) days following any
expiration or termination of this Agreement, except that the Receiving Party may retain
one copy of the Confidential Information for legal archival purposes. All Confidential
Information of a Disclosing Party (including all copies thereof) shall be and at all times
remain the property of such Disclosing Party.

Ownership - Confidential Information (including all copies thereof) disclosed by the
Disclosing Party hereunder shall remain the property of such Disclosing Party. Nothing
in this Agreement shall be construed, by implication or otherwise, as a grant,
assignment, lease, mortgage of any right or license to the Confidential Information,
trademarks, inventions, copyrights or patents, as a grant of a license to either Receiving
Party to use any of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information except as expressly
set forth herein, or as an obligation to enter into any further agreements relating to any
Confidential Information or any possible business relationship.

Irreparable Harm - The Parties acknowledge and expressly agree that any disclosure,
in violation of this Agreement, of the Information by the Receiving Party thereof could
be detrimental to the Disclosing Party”s business and may cause it irreparable harm and
damage. In accordance with applicable law and in addition to any other rights and
remedies provided herein, such Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek equitable relief
by way of injunction or otherwise.

4. LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION

41.

4.2.

43.

 

Mutual Representations - Each Party hereby represents and warrants to the other Party
that (a) it has the requisite power and authority to enter into this MOU and to perform
according to its terms, and that the official signing this MOU has the authority to do so;
(b) the execution, delivery and performance by the Party of this MOU do not and will
not contravene or conflict with the governing documents of the Party or any applicable
laws, or constitute a default in any material respect under any agreement or instrument
to which the Party is a party; and (c) it is financially able to satisfy all funding
commitments made in any joint activities.

DISCLAIMER OF REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES - EXCEPT FOR
THE REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES PROVIDED IN SECTION 4.1 OF
THIS MOU, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY REPRESENTATION OR GRANTS
ANY WARRANTY HEREUNDER, TO THE OTHER PARTY, WHETHER
EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AS TO ANY MATTER WHATSOEVER.

Indemnification - Each Party shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless the É T,
Party, its Affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees and agents .

and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses (includ Jg
reasonable attorneys” fees and expenses) in connection with any and all su
investigations, claims or demands of third parties arising from or occurring as a res
of: (a) any material breach by the indemnifying Party of this MOU, (b) the gr:
negligence or willful misconduct on the part of the indemnifying Party or its Affiliat:
or their respective directors, officers, employees, and agents in the performance of
obligations or exercise of rights under this MOU, or (c) any violation of applicable law

  
   
44.

by the indemnifying Party or its Affiliates or their respective directors, officers,
employees, and agents in the performance of obligations or exercise of rights under this
MOU, except, in each case ((a)-(c)), for those Losses for which the indemnified Party
has an obligation to indemnify the indemnifying Party pursuant to this Section 4.3, as
to which Losses each Party shall indemnify the other only to the extent of their
respective liability.

LIMITATION ON LIABILITY - IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE
LIABLE FOR SPECIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL
DAMAGES, OR FOR LOST REVENUE, WHETHER IN CONTRACT,
WARRANTY, NEGLIGENCE, TORT, STRICT LIABILITY OR OTHERWISE,
ARISING OUT OF ANY BREACH OF OR FAILURE TO PERFORM ANY OF THE
PROVISIONS OF THIS MOU.

5. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

51.

52.

Governing Law - This MOU shall be governed by and construed in accordance with
the laws of India.

Arbitration - Any dispute or controversy arising out of this MOU that cannot be settled
amicably by the Parties shall be resolved by binding arbitration under Arbitration and
Conciliation Act, 1996. The place of arbitration shall be Hyderabad, India. Nothing in
this Section 5.2 shall preclude either Party from seeking interim or provisional relief,
including a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction or other interim
equitable relief, concerning a dispute either prior to or during any arbitration if
necessary, to protect the interests of such Party.

6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS

61
(a)

)

(o)

bi; q

>

Definitions:

“Invention” shall mean any discovery, concept, or idea, whether or not patentable, and
arising directly from the performance of the Purpose under this MOU, including but not
limited to processes, methods, software, tangible research products, formulas and
techniques, improvements thereto, and know-how related thereto.

“Intelleetual Property Rights” shall mean patents, trademarks, trade names, service
marks, domain names copyrights, trade-secret, Know-How, natural, hybrid,
recombinant and synthetic biological material and improvements and modifications
therein, rights in and to databases (including rights to prevent the extraction or
reutilization of information from a database), design rights, topography rights and qll
rights or forms of protection of a similar nature or having equivalent or the similar effebt
to any of them which may subsist any where in the world, whether or not any of th
are registered/granted and/or either may include applications for registration of any bf
them or may not have applied for registration but still would be considered to inclut
as Intellectual Property.

 
 
  
 

“Know How” shall mean all technical and other information which is not in the public
domain (other than as a result of a breach of confidence), including but not limited to
information comprising or relating to concepts, discoveries, data, designs, formulae,
ideas, inventions, methods, models, procedures, designs for experiments and tests and
results of experimentation and testing, processes, specifications and techniques,
laboratory records, clinical data, manufacturing data and information contained in
submissions to regulatory authorities, whether or not protected by Intellectual Property
Rights or any applications for such rights.

6.2 Each Party shall remain sole owner and has exclusive rights, title and interests, on any

and all of the Intellectual Property Rights, which has been conceived or developed, at
any time, independent of the other Party under this MOU.

6.3 All rights, title and interests in any Invention, Intellectual Property Rights conceived,

developed and/or reduced to practice as a direct or indirect result of the performance by
either of the Parties under this Agreement shall solely belong to BBIL. BBIL shall be
solely responsible for expenses incurred in the filing, prosecution, issuance and/ or
maintenance of any patent application or patent issuing thereon. Further prosecution,
litigation and costs including attorney*s fee, if any, shall thereafter be borne by BBIL.
Presica and Envixia shall cooperate with BBIL, in good faith and in the best of its
capability, to support with documents and information, as may be necessary for
successful implementation, including without limitation, documentation, prosecution
and litigation proceedings.

7. MISCELLANEOUS

71.

73.

74.

7.5.

7.6.

Waiver - No failure or delay on the part of either party in exercising any right, power
or privilege under this MOU will operate as waiver thereof, nor will any single or partial
exercise of any such right, power or privilege operate as a waiver of any subsequent
exercise thereof.

Assignment - Without the prior written consent of the other Party, neither Party shall
sell, transfer, assign, delegate, pledge or otherwise dispose of, whether voluntarily,
involuntarily, by operation of law or otherwise, this MOU, or any of its rights or duties
hereunder or thereunder.

Notices - All notices under this MOU shall be in writing and shall be deemed to be
given when personally delivered or when sent by fax or when sent by confirmed e-mail
or when sent by post to the address of the party set out in this MOU.

Independent Contractors - The relationship of the Parties is that of independent
contractors and not agents of each other or joint ventures or partners, regardless of
whether either or both Parties establish an office in the headquarters of the other Party.
Each Party shall maintain sole and exclusive control over its personnel and operations.
Neither Party shall have the power to bind or obligate the other Party in any manner,
including in connection with fundraising, grant-writing, advocacy and policy-rela!
activities.

Entire MOU - This MOU constitutes the entire agreement between the Partits
pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior oral or wri
agreements, understanding, negotiations and discussions between the Parties pertaini
to such subject matter.

Amendments - If either Party desires a modification to or extension of this MOU, the

lx 1&

To

 

 
 
   
 
 
77.

7.8.

7.9.

Parties shall, upon reasonable notice of the proposed modification or extension, confer
in good faith to determine the desirability of such modification or extension. Such
modification or extension shall not be effective until a written amendment is executed
by the duly authorized representatives of each Party.

Severability - In the event that any provision of this MOU is deemed illegal, invalid
or unenforceable under present or future laws, it shall be ineffective to the extent of
such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability without affecting in any way the
remaining provisions or conditions of this MOU. The Parties shall remain legally bound
by the remaining terms of this MOU and shall strive to reform the MOU in a manner
consistent with the original intent of the Parties.

Force-majeure - Ifat any time during the existence of this MOU, either party is unable
to perform whole or in part any of its obligations because of war, hostility, military
operations of any character, acts of Government, sabotage, fire, floods, explosions,
epidemics, strikes and any other matter which are beyond human control, then the date
of any obligation under this MOU shall be postponed during the time for which such
circumstances are operative.

Counterparts; Facsimile Execution - This MOU may be executed in two (2) or more
counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall
constitute one and the same instrument. This MOU may be executed by facsimile or
electronically transmitted signatures and such signatures shall be deemed to bind each
Party hereto as if they were original signatures.

Name: Mr. Anudesh Goyal-
Title: ' General Manager —
Date:

Witness (In the presence of)

 

( Company stamp )

 

 
Schedule 1
Scope of Work

1. Overview

BBIL's Covid-19 Vaccine shall undergo local clinical trials in Brazil and shall apply for
registration and approval by the Brazilian regulatory authorities for distribution in Brazil.

2. Roles and responsibilities of BBIL:

A. Researchand development (R&D) and manufacture of the Covid-19 vaccine with the
highest standards;

B. Provide guidance on clinical trial design and protocols;

C. Shall only provide technical support from India to the appointed Clinical Research

Organization (CRO). The CRO and the regional entities shall be responsible for

staging and monitoring of clinical trial;

Provide Precisa all necessary documents to support all forms of regulatory filings;

BBIL shall allocate vaccine stocks for Brazil (via Precisa), once Precisa provides an

Advanced Market Commitment (AMC) and after mutual discussion number of doses

to be allocated, and the price is decided, which Precisa will have to confirm by a

certain date;

F. Support Precisa's marketing activities relating to presentation of data on BBIL's
vaccine. BBIL shall only provide clinical data as and when available publically in
order to present to various medical boards and key opinion leaders.

G. Shall appoint Precisa as an exclusive distributor for BBILs COVID-19 vaccine
candidate in Brazil provided the following conditions have been met:

i. The Indian Government provides consent to export BBILs COVID-19 vaccine
candidate.

ii. All regulatory clearances in India and Brazil have been achieved.

mu

3. Roles and responsibilities of Precisa:

A. Apply for local clinical trial and secure approval of the Covid-19 Vaccine from
regulator(s) in Brazil, if needed;

B. Sponsor / co-finance local clinical trial of the Covid-19 Vaccine , ifneeded;

C. Appoint and fund CRO, principal investigator(s) and other related expenses;

D. File for certificate of product registration (CPR) or certificate of exemption (COE) or
applicable permit to import and distribute the Covid-19 Vaccine;

E

Import and distribute the Covid-19 Vaccine for both private sector and public sector
(government).

4. Roles and responsibilities of Envixia:

   
 

A. Provide support for all activities related to registering and commercializing BBILs
COVID-19 vaccine in Brazil.

Senhor Diretor-Presidente,

1. O Brasil enfrenta, hoje, momento crítico da pandemia de Covid-19. A
vacinação contra a Covid-19 é estratégia prioritária do Ministério da Saúde para
enfrentamento da pandemia, razão pela qual já vacinamos mais de 12 milhões
de pessoas até a presente data.

2. Nesse contexto, e levando em consideração o contrato celebrado
entre o govemo brasileiro e a Bharat Biotech, por intermédio da Precisa
Medicamentos, no dia 25 de fevereiro de 2021, cujo objeto é a aquisição da
vacina COVAXIN/BBV152, a serem entregues em cinco lotes de 4 (quatro)
milhões de doses, muito agradeceria avaliar a possibilidade de antecipar o
máximo número possível de doses ao Brasil, fornecendo idealmente 10 (dez)
milhões de doses já no primeiro lote, neste mês de março de 2021.

3. A vacinação da população tem potencial de conter a transmissão do
novo coronavírus e suas variantes, salvar vidas e minimizar os impactos sociais
e econômicos no Brasil. O Brasil precisa de apoio para a intensificação da
imunização contra a Covid-19 com vistas ao recrudescimento da pandemia e a
proliferação de novas variantes.
Atenciosamente,

ANTÔNIO ELCIO FRANCO FILHO
Secretário-Executivo

maximianoQprecisamedicamentos.com.br

Dear Sir,

1. Brazil is currently facing a critical moment in the COVID-19
pandemic. The vaccination against COVID-19 is the central strategy of the
Ministry of Health, reason why we already vaccinated 12 million people so far.

2. In this context, and taking into account the contract signed between
the Brazilian government and Bharat Biotech, through Precisa Medicamentos, on
February 25, 2021, on the procurement of the vaccine COVAXIN/BBV152, to be
delivered in five lots of 4 (four) million doses, I would kindly ask to evaluate the
possibility of anticipating the maximum possible number of doses to Brazil,
ideally supplying 10 (ten) million doses already in the first batch, during this
month of March 2021.

3. The vaccination of the Brazilian people has the potential to contain
the transmission of the new coronavirus and its variants, to save lives and to
minimize social and economic impacts in Brazil. Brazil needs support to
strengthen the immunization against Covid-19 with a view to avoid the
resurgence of the pandemic and the proliferation of new variants.

Yours sincerely,

ANTÔNIO ELCIO FRANCO FILHO
Vice Minister of Health

Brasília, 19 de março de 2021.

Ao: GAB/SVSMS
Assunto: Autorização de importação da vacina Covid-19 da empresa Bharat Biotech Limited International

1. Trata-se do Contrato Administrativo nº 29/2021 firmado com a empresa BHARAT
BIOTECH LIMITED INTERNATIONAL, representada pela empresa PRECISA COMERCIALIZAÇÃO
DE MEDICAMENTOS LTDAL. O Contrato firmado prevê a entrega de 20.000.000 doses conforme o

para apreciação, autorização e posterior envio à Secretaria Executiva visando a aprovação do pedido de
concessão da Licença de Importação.

4. Sugerimos que após aprovação da Secretaria Executiva encaminhe-se ao Departamento de
Logística (DLOG) para prosseguimento dos trâmites de importação.

Coordenação-Geral de Aquisições de Insumos Estratégicos para Saúde
Coordenação de Licitações e Análise de Mercado de Insumos Estratégicos para
Saúde
Divisão de Análise das Aquisições de Insumos Estratégicos para Saúde

DESPACHO

DIVAN/COLMER/CGIES/DLOG/SE/MS
Brasília, 22 de março de 2021.

Ao Departamento de Imunização e Doenças Transmissíveis - DEIDT,
À Coordenação-Geral de Execução Orçamentária e Financeira - CGORF,

Assunto: Acompanhamento da execução contratual.

1. Trata-se do Contrato Administrativo nº 29/2021 (0019155275),
firmado entre o Ministério da Saúde e a empresa BHARAT BIOTECH LIMITED
INTERNATIONAL, representanda pela empresa PRECISA COMERCIALIZAÇÃO DE
MEDICAMENTOS LTDA, que tem por objeto a aquisição de VACINA COVID-19
(CORONAVIRUS, SARS-COV-2), INJETÁVEL (Covaxin/BBV152), conforme os
autos do Processo Eletrônico de Compras nº 25000.175250/2020-85.

2. Por meio da Portaria nº 65/2021 (0019528267), publicada no BSE nº
12 de 22/03/2021 as servidoras REGINA CÉLIA SILVA OLIVEIRA e RENATA
MARQUES DE MELO foram designadas para acompanhar e fiscalizar o referido
contrato.

3. Por todo o exposto, encaminhamos o processo a esse Departamento,
por ser a área demandante, a fim de dar prosseguimento ao feito até o término
contratual, acompanhando e fiscalizando a sua execução.

4. Em tempo, encaminhamos a Apólice de Seguro Garantia
(0019670067) para a guarda da Coordenação-Geral de Execução Orçamentária e
Financeira - CGORF, conforme previsto no Decreto nº 8.901, de 10/11/2016, art.
121, inciso XI:

"XI - receber, registrar, guardar e restituir as garantias contratuais referentes

às compras de bens e de contratação de serviços relativos a insumos
estratégicos para a saúde."

Atenciosamente,

Michelle Araújo Soares
Chefe da Divisão de Análise das Aquisições de Insumos Estratégicos para Saúde

De acordo.

Marcelo Batista Costa
Coordenador-Geral Substituto de Aquisições de Insumos Estratégicos para Saúde

Referência: Processo nº 25000.175250/2020-85 SEI nº 0019734182
TCU TRIBUNAL DE CONTAS DA UNIÃO TC 006.851/2021-5

GRUPO II — CLASSE III — Plenário
TC 006.851/2021-5

Natureza: Consulta

Órgão/Entidade: Ministério da Saúde
Representação legal: não há

SUMÁRIO: CONSULTA FORMULADA PELO MINISTRO DE
ESTADO DA SAÚDE SOBRE A MELHOR EXEGESE A
RESPEITO DOS ARTS. 2º DA MEDIDA PROVISÓRIA
1003/2020 E 12 DA MEDIDA PROVISÓRIA 1.026/2021, QUE
FORAM, RESPECTIVAMENTE, CONVERTIDAS NAS LEIS
14.121/2021 E 14.124/2021.

RELATÓRIO

Cuidam os autos de consulta protocolada pelo Ministro de Estado da Saúde Eduardo
Pazvello, consubstanciada nos seguintes termos:

“1. As disposições do art. 12 da MP 1.026/2021 e/ou do art. 2% caput da MP 1.003/2020
garantem validade para cláusulas que seriam, de outra forma, consideradas inválidas pela teoria
geral dos contratos, seja por disposição legal expressa, seja por violação à ordem pública?

2. As disposições do art. 12 da MP 1.026/2021 e/ou do art. 2º, caput da MP 1.003/2020 ou
ainda o regramento dos arts. 439 e 440 do Código Civil possibilitam que a autoridade contratante
preveja, de forma válida, no instrumento contratual disposições que estejam fora da esfera de
atribuições, tais como a aprovação de leis ou a expedição de atos de incumbência de outros
ministérios?

a. Em caso positivo, tais disposições possuem a natureza de obrigação (de modo que
executáveis), de promessa de terceiro (gerando direito a indenização no caso de não execução) ou não
produzem efeito algum?

3. As disposições do art. 12 da MP 1.026/2021 e/ou do art. 2º, caput da MP 1.003/2020
possibilitam o afastamento de normas contrárias que não possuem natureza contratual?

a. É permitido o afastamento de normas de caráter processual, tais como as previstas na
Lei nº 9.784/99 e no Código de Processo Civil?

b. É permitido o afastamento de normas de caráter patrimonial-administrativo, tais como
as previstas no Código Civil?

c. É permitido o afastamento de normas de caráter financeiro-orçamentário, tais como as
previstas na Lei de Responsabilidade Fiscal ou na Lei nº 4.320/64?

d. É permitido o afastamento de normas relavas à responsabilidade extracontratual para
com terceiros não- contratantes, tais como as previstas no Código Civil ou no Código de Defesa do
Consumidor?

e É permitido o afastamento de normas de caráter internacional, tais como as previstas
na Convenção de Viena sobre Relações Diplomáticas?

4. É admissível que, em um contrato de fornecimento de vacinas, o Poder Público assuma
a integralidade ou a quase integralidade dos riscos contratuais na alocação de riscos prevista? a.
1

Para verificar as assinaturas, acesse www.tcu.gov.br/autenticidade, informando o código 67344858.
TCU TRIBUNAL DE CONTAS DA UNIÃO TC 006.851/2021-5

Considerando a situação delicada envolvida, qual deve ser a análise de riscos a ser feita pelo gestor
ao decidir pela admissibilidade ou não de certas cláusulas de alocação de riscos?”

2. O auditor da SecexSaúde se manifestou da seguinte forma — instrução transcrita
parcialmente com os ajustes pertinentes:

“EXAME DE ADMISSIBILIDADE

3. A presente consulta deve ser conhecida, vez que formulada por autoridade que possui

legitimidade para tanto, acerca da aplicabilidade, em tese, de dispositivos legais e regulamentares
concernentes à matéria de competência deste Tribunal, de modo que se encontram satisfeitos os
requisitos de admissibilidade previstos no art. 264, inciso VI, 8$ 1º e 2º do Regimento Interno do TCU.

EXAME TÉCNICO

4. Inicialmente impende destacar que as normas sobre as quais foram suscitadas as dúvidas
na presente consulta tratam de medidas provisórias, as quais, por força do artigo 62 da CRFB, têm
força de lei.

5. A consulta tem por objeto dúvidas relacionadas à aplicação do artigo 12 da Medida
Provisória (MP) 1026/2021 e o artigo 2º, caput, da Medida Provisória 1.003/2020.
6. Importante destacar que a MP 1026/2021 dispõe sobre medidas excepcionais relativas à

aquisição de vacinas, insumos, bens e serviços de diversas naturezas destinados à vacinação contra
Covid-19 e sobre o Plano Nacional de Operacionalização da Vacinação contra a Covid-19. A MP
1.003/2020, por sua vez, tem objeto mais específico, relacionado à autorização do Poder Executivo
federal a aderir ao Instrumento de Acesso Global de Vacinas Covid-29- Covax Facility.

7. Cabe salientar que a MP 1.003/2020 foi convertida na Lei 14.121 em 1º de março de 2021.
A MP 1026/2021, por sua vez, em sessão deliberativa de 2/3/2021, teve seu projeto de lei de conversão
aprovado e foi remetido para sanção presidencial.

€ > Q  & coreressonacional leg srjmaterias/mecidas-prow'sorias)-tmpunetrsa
